entries: You use a performer's cold reading techniques, aura reading, and other tricks to discover your foe's strengths and weaknesses. The GM rolls a secret {@skill Occultism|PC1} check for you against the {@skill Deception|PC1} or {@skill Stealth|PC1} DC (whichever is higher) of an enemy of your choice who is not {@condition concealed|PC1} from you, {@condition hidden|PC1} from you, or {@condition undetected|PC1} by you, and who is engaged in combat. The GM might apply a penalty for the distance between you and the enemy. The enemy is then temporarily immune to your Combat Reading for 1 day.

Critical Success: The GM chooses and tells you two of the following pieces of information about the enemy: which of the enemy's weaknesses is highest, which of the enemy's saving throws has the lowest modifier, one immunity the enemy has, or which of the enemy's resistances is highest.
In the event of a tie, the GM should pick one at random.
Success: The GM chooses one piece of information from the above list to tell you about the enemy.
Critical Failure: The GM gives you false information (the GM makes up the information).

feat.name: Courageous Advance
entries: With a rousing call, you exhort an ally to advance. If your next action is to cast the {@spell courageous anthem|PC1} composition cantrip, one ally of your choice who gains a status bonus from the spell can immediately use their reaction to {@action Stride|PC1}.

feat.name: In Tune
entries: You attune your great skill in performing to another, granting them a small measure of your skill as though anyone could do it. If your next action is casting a composition spell with an emanation area, its area spreads from a willing ally of your choice within 60 feet instead of you.
If you have {@feat Directed Audience|PC1}, you can have that cone originate from the ally instead.

feat.name: Melodious Spell
entries: You subtly weave your spellcasting into a performance. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1}, the spell gains the {@trait subtle} trait, hiding the shining runes, sparks of magic, and other manifestations that would usually give away your spellcasting. The trait hides only the spell's spellcasting actions and manifestations, not its effects, so an observer might still see a ray streak out from you or see you vanish into thin air.

As part of using Melodious Spell, you can choose to {@action Create a Diversion|PC1}, {@action Demoralize|PC1}, {@action Perform|PC1}, or {@action Request|PC1}. If you do so, the spell you cast must have the auditory, emotion, {@trait sonic}, or {@trait visual} trait to gain the {@trait subtle} trait.

feat.name: Rallying Anthem
entries: You learn the {@spell rallying anthem|PC1} composition cantrip, which protects you and allies.

feat.name: Ritual Researcher
entries: Careful research into the art of rituals has made you better at performing them. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to all primary and secondary checks you attempt as part of casting a ritual.

feat.name: Triple Time
entries: You learn the {@spell triple time|PC1} composition cantrip, which speeds up you and your allies for a round.

feat.name: Versatile Signature
entries: While most bards are known for certain signature performances and spells, you're always tweaking your available repertoire. When you make your daily preparations, you can change one of your signature spells to a different spell of that rank from your repertoire.

feat.name: Assured Knowledge
entries: You can procure information with confidence. Whenever you {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1} using any skill (including {@skill Lore|PC1|Bardic Lore}), you can forgo rolling your check to instead receive a result of 10 + your proficiency bonus (don't apply any other bonuses, penalties, or modifiers).

As long as you are an expert in a skill, you meet the prerequisites for the {@feat Automatic Knowledge|PC1} skill feat for that skill, even if you don't have the {@feat Assurance|PC1} feat for that skill.

feat.name: Defensive Coordination
entries: Like the storied heroes who persist in the face of overwhelming odds, you and your allies will hold the line. If your next action is to cast the {@spell rallying anthem|PC1} composition cantrip, you can {@action Raise a Shield|PC1}, and one ally of your choice who gains a status bonus from the spell can immediately use their reaction to {@action Raise a Shield|PC1}.

feat.name: Dirge of Doom
entries: You learn the {@spell dirge of doom|PC1} composition cantrip, which frightens your enemies and keeps them from fully recovering from their fear.

feat.name: Educate Allies
feat.trigger: An ally benefiting from one of your composition spells is subject to an effect with the auditory, illusion, linguistic, {@trait sonic}, or {@trait visual} trait.
entries: You tweak the properties of your composition spell to convey a bit of your defensive knowledge. All allies affected by your composition spell gain your +1 circumstance bonus from Well-Versed until the start of your next turn. Teaching your allies also bolsters your own skills; your personal circumstance bonus from Well-Versed also increases to +2 until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Harmonize
entries: You can perform multiple compositions simultaneously, typically by performing in multiple ways at the same time, using special vocal techniques to double your voice, or creating occult magic that replicates your song or speech.

If your next action is to cast a composition, it becomes a harmonized composition. Unlike a normal composition, a harmonized composition doesn't end if you cast another composition, and you can cast another composition on the same turn as a harmonized one. Casting another harmonized composition ends any harmonized composition you already have in effect.

feat.name: Song of Marching
entries: You learn the {@spell song of marching|PC1} composition cantrip, which enables you and your allies to cross vast distances without strain.

feat.name: Steady Spellcasting
entries: You don't lose spells easily. If a reaction would disrupt your spellcasting action, attempt a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check. If you succeed, your action isn't disrupted.

feat.name: Accompany
feat.trigger: An ally within 30 feet Casts a Spell.
entries: You use your performance to supplement an ally's spellcasting, providing magical energy for their spell in their stead. Attempt a {@skill Performance|PC1} check, using a very high DC for the ally's level, and either spend a Focus Point (if the triggering spell is a focus spell) or expend a spell slot at least 1 rank higher than the triggering spell. If you succeed at your {@skill Performance|PC1} check, your ally's spell doesn't cost the Focus Point or spell slot that ally would normally need to spend.

feat.name: Call and Response
entries: Your composition takes the form of a call-and-response chant that lets your allies continue the effect without you. If your next action is to cast a composition cantrip with a duration of 1 round, it becomes a call. While the spell is active, one ally of your choice affected by the spell can respond to your call as a single action that has the {@trait auditory} and {@trait concentrate} traits to extend the spell's duration by 1 round. Only one ally can respond to a given call, and responding to the ally's response has no additional effect.

feat.name: Eclectic Skill
entries: Your broad experiences translate to a range of skills. Your proficiency bonus to untrained skill checks is equal to your level. You can attempt any skill check that normally requires you to be trained, even if you are untrained. If you have legendary proficiency in {@skill Occultism|PC1}, you can attempt any skill check that normally requires you to have expert proficiency, even if untrained or trained.

feat.name: Fortissimo Composition
entries: Your anthems grow louder and more potent, bolstered by your muse's power. You learn the {@spell fortissimo composition|PC1} spellshape focus spell.

feat.name: Know-It-All
entries: When you succeed at a check to {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1}, you gain additional information or context. When you critically succeed at a check to {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1}, you get additional information or context or can ask an additional follow-up question (the GM chooses which).

feat.name: Reflexive Courage
feat.trigger: A creature within your reach uses an {@trait auditory} effect, manipulate action, or move action; makes a ranged attack; or leaves a square during its move action.
feat.requirements: You are affected by {@spell courageous anthem|PC1}.
entries: You bellow a ferocious call to arms, inspiring yourself to lash out at a foe. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the action is disrupted.

feat.name: Soulsight
entries: Your muse has opened your senses to the world beyond. You gain spiritsense as an imprecise sense with a range of 60 feet. Spiritsense enables you to sense the spirits of creatures, including living creatures, most non-mindless undead, and haunts within the listed range. As with your hearing and other imprecise senses, you still need to {@action Seek|PC1} to locate an {@condition undetected|PC1} creature.

As spiritsense detects spiritual essence, not physical bodies, it can detect spirits projected by spells such as project image or possessing otherwise soulless objects. It can't detect soulless bodies, constructs, or objects, and like most senses, it doesn't penetrate through solid objects.

feat.name: Annotate Composition
entries: By putting composition to paper, you can create a source of stirring words or song that others can read and understand. You spend 10 minutes and 1 Focus Point to transpose a composition spell on a special scroll that you or another creature can later activate. This composition spell must take a single action to cast. If the chosen composition spell requires a {@skill Performance|PC1} check as part of the casting, the GM rolls this check as a secret check when you annotate your score.

If you have {@feat fortissimo composition|PC1} or {@feat lingering composition|PC1}, you can also use one of those spells to modify the annotated composition, provided the annotated composition can benefit from the modification. The GM rolls the secret {@skill Performance|PC1} check. If you do, you spend an additional Focus Point, even if the secret check fails.
Any creature that can read the language you used when annotating your composition can Activate the Item by spending a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} trait.
This produces the effects of the composition as though the activating creature had {@action Cast the Spell|Cast a Spell}.

A composition you create this way loses its power the next time you make your daily preparations. While the composition is in your possession, you can render it inert using a single action that has the {@trait concentrate} trait. You can't regain the Focus Points you spent to create the annotated composition until it is activated or loses its magic.

feat.name: Courageous Assault
entries: With a mighty shout, you can stir an ally to attack. If your next action is to cast the {@spell courageous anthem|PC1} composition cantrip, one ally of your choice who gains a status bonus from the spell can immediately use their reaction to make a melee {@action Strike|PC1}.

feat.name: House of Imaginary Walls
entries: You erect an imaginary barrier others believe to be real. You learn the {@spell house of imaginary walls|PC1} composition cantrip.

feat.name: Ode to Ouroboros
entries: You learn the {@spell ode to ouroboros|PC1} composition spell, which enables you to temporarily spare your allies from death.

feat.name: Quickened Casting
entries: If your next action is to cast a bard cantrip or a bard spell that is at least 2 ranks lower than the highest-rank bard spell slot you have, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

feat.name: Symphony of the Unfettered Heart
entries: You learn the {@spell symphony of the unfettered heart|PC1} composition spell, which enables you to protect an ally against incapacitating conditions.

feat.name: Unusual Composition
entries: You can translate the emotion and power of a composition to other mediums. If your next action is to cast a composition spell that is auditory or visual, you can have it affect creatures who can witness it with any sense, not just those the traits indicate, even including special senses like tremorsense. You can choose to exclude any senses you choose.

feat.name: Eclectic Polymath
entries: Your flexible mind can quickly shift from one spell to another.

If you add a spell to your repertoire during your daily preparations using {@feat Esoteric Polymath|PC1}, when you prepare again, you can choose to keep the new spell from {@feat Esoteric Polymath|PC1} in your repertoire and instead lose access to another spell of the same rank in your repertoire.

feat.name: Enigma's Knowledge
entries: Your muse whispers knowledge to you at all the right times. You gain the benefits of the {@feat Automatic Knowledge|PC1} skill feat with any skill you can use to {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1}. As per the special clause in the Automatic Knowledge feat, you can still only use Automatic Knowledge once per round.

feat.name: Inspirational Focus
entries: Your connection to your muse has granted you unusual focus. Whenever you {@action Refocus|PC1}, completely refill your focus pool.

feat.name: Reverberate
feat.trigger: A creature or hazard would deal sonic damage to you.
entries: You can manipulate the acoustics around you to deflect sonic damage back at its source. Attempt a {@skill Performance|PC1} check against the Will DC of the creature or Fortitude DC of a hazard. If the damage came from a spell, use the creature's spell DC if it's lower.

Critical Success: You reduce the triggering damage by an amount up to four times your level. The creature takes sonic damage equal to the amount of damage you reduced in this way.
Success: As critical success, but you reduce the triggering damage by an amount up to twice your level.

feat.name: Shared Assault
entries: In the triumph of battle, you can share the glory with another ally. When the ally you chose for Courageous Assault critically succeeds at the {@action Strike|PC1} granted by that action, another ally affected by your {@spell courageous anthem|PC1} composition spell can immediately use a reaction to make a melee {@action Strike|PC1}. This effect doesn't continue to a third ally, even if the second ally also critically succeeds.

feat.name: Allegro
entries: You can quicken your allies with a fast-paced performance. You learn the {@spell allegro|PC1} composition cantrip.

feat.name: Earworm
entries: By endlessly repeating a motif, you implant a memorable song that repeats over and over again in your allies' heads, preparing them to respond to it later. Choose a composition cantrip and spend 10 minutes repeating a melody, chant, speech, series of motions, or a similar performance that embodies that cantrip. This activity gains the traits appropriate to the type of performance.
You implant the earworm within all allies who can see or hear you (as appropriate for the type of performance) for the entire activity.

Once you've created the earworm, you can attempt a {@skill Performance|PC1} check as a free action to activate it. This check uses the highest Will DC of the earworm's targets present at the time of activation. On a success, you cast the cantrip on all allies who learned the earworm and can perceive your performance; on a failure, the earworm is corrupted and lost. Because it is based on the earlier repetitions, you can't use further free actions like {@spell lingering composition|PC1} or {@spell fortissimo composition|PC1} to modify the activated earworm. Allies forget the earworm after it is activated, if you spend 10 minutes to implant another earworm, or during your next daily preparations, whichever comes first.

feat.name: Soothing Ballad
entries: You soothe your allies' wounds with the power of performance. You learn the {@spell soothing ballad|PC1} composition spell.

feat.name: Triumphant Inspiration
feat.trigger: You critically hit a foe with a melee weapon {@action Strike|PC1} or a melee unarmed attack.
entries: With a triumphant shout, you inspire your allies. You cast a composition cantrip you know that normally takes a single action to cast.

feat.name: True Hypercognition
entries: Your mind works at an incredible pace. You instantly use up to five {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1} actions. If you have any special abilities or free actions that would normally be triggered when you {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1}, you can't use them for these actions.

feat.name: Vigorous Anthem
entries: You instill magical vigor in your allies when you inspire them to attack. If your next action is to cast the {@spell courageous anthem|PC1} composition cantrip, you and all affected allies gain temporary HP equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier that last for 1 minute.

feat.name: Courageous Onslaught
entries: You use your performance to orchestrate an onslaught against your enemies. If your next action is to cast the {@spell courageous anthem|PC1} composition cantrip, one ally of your choice who gains a status bonus from the spell can immediately use their reaction to {@action Stride|PC1} and then make a melee {@action Strike|PC1}.

feat.name: Effortless Concentration
feat.trigger: Your turn begins.
entries: You can maintain a spell with hardly a thought. You immediately gain the effects of the {@action Sustain|PC1} action, allowing you to extend the duration of one of your active bard spells.

feat.name: Resounding Finale
feat.trigger: You or an ally benefiting from your composition spell would take sonic damage.
entries: You bring your performance to a sudden, dramatic finish, drowning out other sounds. Your composition spell ends immediately, and all allies that had been benefiting from the spell's effects gain sonic resistance against the triggering damage equal to twice the composition spell's rank.

feat.name: Studious Capacity
entries: Your continued study of occult magic has increased your magical capacity, allowing you to cast spells even when it seems impossible. You can cast one spell each day even after you've run out of spell slots of the appropriate spell rank, but you can't use this ability to cast a spell of your highest spell rank.

feat.name: All in My Head
feat.trigger: You would take damage from a {@action Strike|PC1} or spell that doesn't have the {@trait death} trait or otherwise cause instant death (such as disintegrate).
entries: Using your occult connections and incredible powers of persuasion, you convince yourself that the triggering damage is a figment of your imagination. The damage changes from its usual damage type to mental damage, and the damaging effect gains the {@trait nonlethal} trait. You can't use this reaction if you are immune to {@trait mental} effects or mental damage.

feat.name: Deep Lore
entries: Your repertoire is vast, containing far more spells than usual.
Add one spell to your repertoire of each spell rank you can cast.

feat.name: Discordant Voice
entries: Your courageous anthem lets loose a discordant shriek that imbues your allies' attacks with powerful sonic reverberations.
While your allies are affected by your {@spell courageous anthem|PC1}, their weapon Strikes and unarmed attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d6} sonic damage.

feat.name: Eternal Composition
entries: The world is a stage upon which you are always playing. You are permanently {@condition quickened|PC1}; you can use your extra action only to cast a composition cantrip that requires 1 action to cast. While in exploration mode, you can declare that you are performing an eligible composition cantrip while using any exploration tactic. Even before your first turn in a combat encounter, that cantrip is active as if you had cast it on your previous turn.

feat.name: Impossible Polymath
feat.prerequisites: trained in {@skill Arcana|PC1}, {@skill Nature|PC1}, or {@skill Religion|PC1}; {@feat Esoteric Polymath|PC1}
entries: Your esoteric formulas are so unusual that they allow you to dabble in magic from diverse traditions that other bards don't understand. As long as you're trained in {@skill Arcana|PC1}, you can add arcane spells to your book from Esoteric Polymath; as long as you're trained in {@skill Nature|PC1}, you can add primal spells to your book; and as long as you are trained in {@skill Religion|PC1}, you can add divine spells to your book.

Like your other spells in your book, you can add one of these spells from another tradition to your repertoire as an occult spell each day using Esoteric Polymath, but you can't retain any spells from another tradition when you prepare again, even if you have Eclectic Polymath.

feat.name: Fatal Aria
entries: Your songs overwhelm the target with unbearable emotion, potentially striking them dead on the spot. You learn the {@spell fatal aria|PC1} composition spell.

feat.name: Perfect Encore
entries: You develop another incredible creation. You gain an additional 10th-rank spell slot.

feat.name: Symphony of the Muse
entries: You have learned how to weave countless performances together into a solo symphony with multitudinous effects. You are no longer limited to a single composition each turn or a single composition at a time; when you use a new composition, all previous compositions' effects continue for their remaining duration.

feat.name: Ultimate Polymath
entries: You can flexibly cast all of your spells, granting a dizzying array of possible options. All of the spells in your repertoire are signature spells for you.

feat.name: Deadly Simplicity
feat.prerequisites: deity with a simple or unarmed attack favored weapon, trained with your deity's favored weapon
entries: When you are wielding your deity's favored weapon, increase the damage die size of that weapon by one step.
If your deity's favored weapon is an unarmed attack (such as a fist, if you worship {@deity Irori}) and its damage die is smaller than d6, instead increase its damage die size to d6.

feat.name: Divine Castigation
entries: Your deity's grace doesn't extend to your sworn enemies. When you cast a {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} spell, you can add your {@trait holy|PC1} or {@trait unholy|PC1} trait to it. If you do, the spell deals damage to creatures with the opposing trait, even if it wouldn't normally damage them. The spell deals spirit damage when used this way. For example, if you are {@trait holy|PC1}, you could add the {@trait holy|PC1} trait to a {@spell heal|PC1} spell and deal spirit damage to a fiend that has the {@trait unholy|PC1} trait.

feat.name: Domain Initiate
entries: Your deity bestows a special spell related to their powers. Select one domain—a subject of particular interest to you within your religion—from your deity's list. You gain an initial domain spell for that domain, a spell unique to the domain and not available to other clerics.

Domain spells are a type of focus spell. It costs 1 Focus Point to cast a focus spell, and you start with a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. You refill your focus pool during your daily preparations, and you can regain 1 Focus Point by spending 10 minutes using the {@action Refocus|PC1} activity to pray to your deity or do service toward their causes.

Focus spells are automatically heightened to half your level rounded up, much like cantrips. Focus spells don't require spell slots, and can't be cast using spell slots. Your focus pool can hold one Focus Point for each focus spell you have, up to 3 points.
special: You can select this feat multiple times, selecting a different domain each time and gaining its domain spell.

feat.name: Harming Hands
entries: The mordant power of your void energy grows. When you cast {@spell harm|PC1}, you roll d10s instead of d8s.

feat.name: Healing Hands
entries: Your vitality is even more vibrant and restorative. When you cast {@spell heal|PC1}, you roll d10s instead of d8s.

feat.name: Premonition of Avoidance
feat.trigger: You are about to roll a saving throw against a hazard.
entries: Your deity grants you a moment's foresight. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the triggering saving throw.

feat.name: Reach Spell
entries: You can extend the range of your spells. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet. As is standard for increasing spell ranges, if the spell normally has a range of touch, you extend its range to 30 feet.

feat.name: Cantrip Expansion
entries: You study a wider range of simple spells. You can prepare two additional cantrips each day.

feat.name: Communal Healing
entries: You're an exceptional conduit for vitality and, as you channel it through you, you can divert some to heal yourself or another creature. When you cast the {@spell heal|PC1} spell to heal a single creature, choose another willing living creature within range of your heal to regain Hit Points equal to the {@spell heal|PC1} spell's rank.

feat.name: Emblazon Armament
entries: Carefully etching a sacred image into a physical object, you steel yourself for battle. You can spend 10 minutes emblazoning a symbol of your deity upon a weapon or shield. The symbol doesn't fade until 1 year has passed, but if you Emblazon an Armament, any symbol you previously emblazoned, and any symbol already emblazoned on that item instantly disappears.

The emblazoned item is a religious symbol of your deity in addition to its normal purpose, and it gains another benefit determined by the type of item. The benefit applies only to followers of the deity the symbol represents, but others can use the item normally

items: {@b Shield} The shield gains a +1 status bonus to its Hardness. (This causes it to reduce more damage with the Shield Block reaction.)
{@b Weapon} The wielder gains a +1 status bonus to damage rolls with the weapon.

feat.name: Panic the Dead
entries: Vitality strikes terror in the undead. When you use a {@spell heal|PC1} spell to damage undead, any undead that fails its saving throw is also {@condition frightened||frightened 1}. If it critically failed, the creature also gains the {@condition fleeing|PC1} condition until the start of your next turn. Mindless undead are not immune to this effect due to being mindless.

feat.name: Rapid Response
feat.trigger: An ally is reduced to 0 Hit Points.
entries: You work quickly in emergencies. You {@action Stride|PC1} towards the triggering ally. You gain a +10-foot circumstance bonus to your Speed during this movement.

feat.name: Sap Life
entries: You draw the life force out of your enemies. When you cast a {@spell harm|PC1} spell and damage at least one living creature, you regain Hit Points equal to the spell rank of your {@spell harm|PC1} spell. If you aren't a living creature, you gain no benefit from this feat.

feat.name: Versatile Font
feat.prerequisites: harmful font or healing font, deity that allows clerics to have both fonts
entries: As you explore your deity's aspects, you move beyond restrictions on healing or harming. You can prepare either {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} in the spell slots gained from the harmful font or healing font.

feat.name: Warpriest's Armor
entries: Your training has helped you adapt to ever-heavier armor. You are trained in heavy armor. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in medium armor, you also gain that proficiency in heavy armor. You treat armor you wear of 2 Bulk or higher as though it were 1 Bulk lighter (to a minimum of 1 Bulk).

feat.name: Channel Smite
feat.cost: Expend a {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} spell.
entries: You siphon the energies of life and death through a melee attack and into your foe. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1}. On a hit, you cast the 1-action version of the expended spell to damage the target, in addition to the normal damage from your {@action Strike|PC1}. The target automatically gets a failure on its save (or a critical failure if your {@action Strike|PC1} was a critical hit). The spell doesn't have the {@trait manipulate} trait when cast this way.

The spell is expended with no effect if your {@action Strike|PC1} fails or hits a creature that isn't damaged by that energy type (such as if you hit a non-undead creature with a {@spell heal|PC1} spell).

feat.name: Directed Channel
entries: You can shape the energy you channel in a single direction. When you cast a version of {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} that has an area, you can make its area a 60-foot cone instead of a 30-foot emanation.

feat.name: Divine Infusion
entries: You pour energy into the subject of your healing to empower its attacks. If the next action you use is to cast {@spell harm|PC1} or heal to restore Hit Points to a single creature, the target then deals an additional {@dice 1d6} damage with its melee weapons and unarmed attacks until the end of its next turn. The damage type is void if you cast {@spell harm|PC1} and vitality if you cast {@spell heal|PC1}.
If the spell cast is at least 5th rank, this damage increases to {@dice 2d6}, and if the spell is at least 8th rank, the damage increases to {@dice 3d6}.

feat.name: Raise Symbol
feat.requirements: You are wielding a religious symbol.
entries: You present your religious symbol emphatically. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws until the start of your next turn. While it's raised, if you roll a success at a saving throw against a {@trait vitality} or {@trait void} effect, you get a critical success instead.

If the religious symbol you're raising is a shield, such as with {@feat Emblazon Armaments|PC1}, you gain the effects of {@action Raise a Shield|PC1} when you use this action and the effects of this action when you {@action Raise a Shield|PC1}.

feat.name: Restorative Strike
feat.requirements: You have a {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} spell you can cast.
entries: You balance both sides of the scales, restoring yourself while striking a foe. Cast a 1-action {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} spell to heal yourself, expending the spell normally. It loses the {@trait manipulate} trait when cast this way. Then make a melee {@action Strike|PC1}. If you make this {@action Strike|PC1} with your deity's favored weapon, you gain a +1 status bonus to the attack roll.

If the {@action Strike|PC1} hits, you can target a second willing creature to heal the same amount from the spell. This creature can be outside of the spell's range, provided it's adjacent to the enemy you hit.

feat.name: Sacred Ground
entries: You pray continuously for 1 minute to call a subtle shadow of your deity's realm over a 30-foot burst centered on you. It lasts for 10 minutes, and a creature that remains in the area for the entire 10 minutes regains Hit Points equal to your level.

If you have a healing font, this activity has the {@trait healing} and {@trait vitality} traits and heals living creatures. If you have a harmful font, this activity has the {@trait healing} and {@trait void} traits and heals {@trait undead} creatures (or other creatures with void healing). Clerics with {@feat Versatile Font|PC1} can choose either or both. It can't damage creatures in any case.

feat.name: Cast Down
entries: The sheer force of your faith can bring a foe crashing down. If the next action you use is to cast {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} to damage one creature, the target is knocked {@condition prone|PC1} if it takes any damage from the spell. If the target critically fails its save against the spell, it also takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 minute.

feat.name: Divine Rebuttal
feat.trigger: Your ally is about to roll a saving throw against a magical ability of a creature you're adjacent to.
feat.requirements: You are wielding your deity's favored weapon.
entries: You strive against magical threats physically and spiritually. You can {@action Strike|PC1} the adjacent creature with your deity's favored weapon. If you are {@trait holy|PC1} or {@trait unholy|PC1}, the {@action Strike|PC1} gains that trait.
If your {@action Strike|PC1} hits, all your allies gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the triggering saving throw (or a +3 circumstance bonus on a critical hit).

feat.name: Divine Weapon
feat.trigger: You finish {@action Cast a Spell|PC1|Casting a Spell} using one of your divine spell slots on your turn.
entries: You siphon residual spell energy into a weapon you're wielding.

Until the end of your turn, the weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d4} spirit damage. If you are {@trait holy|PC1} or {@trait unholy|PC1}, Strikes with the weapon also gain that trait, and the additional damage increases to {@dice 2d4} against creatures of the opposing trait.

feat.name: Magic Hands
entries: The blessing of your deity heightens your healing ability, integrating magical healing with the mundane. When you succeed at a {@skill Medicine|PC1} check to {@action Treat Wounds|PC1}, you can roll d10s instead of d8s for the healing and add a status bonus to the healing equal to your level.

feat.name: Selective Energy
entries: As you call down divine power, you can prevent some enemies from benefiting or some allies from being hurt. When you cast a version of {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} that has an area, you can designate up to 5 creatures in the area. They are not targeted by the spell.

feat.name: Steady Spellcasting
entries: Confident in your technique, you don't lose spells easily. If a reaction would disrupt your spellcasting action, attempt a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check. If you succeed, your action isn't disrupted.

feat.name: Advanced Domain
entries: Your prayers have unlocked deeper secrets of your deity's domain.
You gain an advanced domain spell from one of your domains for which you have an initial domain spell (see pages 372–381).
special: You can select this feat multiple times. Each time, you must select a different advanced domain spell.

feat.name: Cremate Undead
entries: Your overwhelming vitality sets undead alight. When you use a {@spell heal|PC1} spell to damage undead, each undead that takes damage also takes {@condition persistent damage|PC1|persistent fire damage} equal to the spell's rank.

feat.name: Emblazon Energy
entries: With elemental forces, you make your emblazoned symbols more potent. When you {@feat Emblazon Armament|PC1|Emblazon an Armament}, you can choose from the following effects instead of the effects listed in that feat. These effects have the same restrictions as the base options.

items: {@b Shield} Choose acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. The wielder gains the shield's circumstance bonus to saving throws against that damage type and can use {@feat Shield Block|PC1} against damage of that type. The shield also gains resistance to that damage type equal to half your level if you have a domain spell with a trait matching that type (such as {@spell fire ray|PC1}).

{@b Weapon} Choose acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. The weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d4} damage of that type. Increase this extra damage to {@dice 1d6} if you have a domain spell with a trait matching that type (such as {@spell fire ray|PC1}).

feat.name: Martyr
entries: You go to extreme lengths to support your allies, even when it means bringing harm to yourself. If your next action is to cast {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} to restore Hit Points to a single ally, you can channel your own vitality along with the spell. You lose {@dice 1d8} Hit Points per rank of the spell, which can't be reduced or mitigated in any way, and your ally regains an equal number of Hit Points.

feat.name: Restorative Channel
entries: You can remove conditions with divine grace. You can sacrifice one {@spell heal|PC1} spell you've prepared in your extra slots from your healing font to cast one of the following spells instead: {@spell cleanse affliction|PC1}, {@spell clear mind|PC1}, {@spell sound body|PC1}, or {@spell sure footing|PC1}. The spell is heightened to the same rank as the spell you sacrificed.

feat.name: Sanctify Armament
entries: You touch a weapon and bring it into concordance with your deity. For 1 round, that weapon gains your {@trait holy|PC1} or {@trait unholy|PC1} trait. It also deals an additional {@damage 2d6} spirit damage to creatures of the opposed trait. For example, if you are {@trait holy|PC1}, the weapon would deal an extra {@damage 2d6} spirit damage to {@trait unholy|PC1} creatures.
If you use Sanctify Armament again, any previous use of it expires.

feat.name: Surging Focus
feat.trigger: An ally you can see falls to 0 Hit Points.
entries: When an ally you can see falls in battle, your surge of righteous indignation allows you to draw upon untapped reserves of divine power. You instantly regain 1 Focus Point.

feat.name: Void Siphon
entries: The raw energy of the Void saps the essence of the living. Any living creature that critically fails its save against a {@spell harm|PC1} spell you cast is {@condition drained|PC1|drained 1}.

feat.name: Zealous Rush
feat.trigger: You cast a divine spell that takes 1 action or more to cast and that affects only you or your equipment.
entries: You bless yourself on the move. {@action Stride|PC1} up to 10 feet. If the spell took 2 or more actions, you can {@action Stride|PC1} up to your full Speed instead.

feat.name: Castigating Weapon
entries: The force of your deity's castigation strengthens your body so you can strike down the enemy and its allies. After you deal spirit damage due to Divine Castigation, your weapon or unarmed Strikes gain your {@trait holy|PC1} or {@trait unholy|PC1} trait and deal additional spirit damage until the end of your turn. The spirit damage is equal to the rank of {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} you dealt spirit damage with, and is in addition to any spirit damage the weapon already deals (such as from a holy rune).

feat.name: Heroic Recovery
entries: The restorative power of your healing invigorates the recipient.

If the next action you use is to cast {@spell heal|PC1} targeting a single living creature and the target regains Hit Points from the spell, the target also gains three bonuses until the end of its next turn: a +5-foot status bonus to its Speed, a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, and a +1 status bonus to damage rolls. In addition, if the target is {@condition prone|PC1}, it can immediately {@action Stand|PC1} as a free action that doesn't trigger reactions.

feat.name: Replenishment of War
feat.prerequisites: expert in your deity's favored weapon
entries: Striking out against your enemies draws praise and protection from your deity. When you damage a creature with a {@action Strike|PC1} using your deity's favored weapon, you gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to half your level, or equal to your level if the {@action Strike|PC1} was a critical hit. These temporary Hit Points last until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Shared Avoidance
entries: You can project your premonitions of danger to your allies. When you use Premonition of Avoidance, allies within 20 feet of you who are rolling the same saving throw against the same hazard also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to their saving throws.

feat.name: Shield of Faith
entries: Residual energy from your domain spells bolsters your defenses. When you spend a Focus Point to cast a domain spell, you gain a +1 status bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Defensive Recovery
entries: Your faith provides temporary protection in addition to healing.

If the next action you use is to cast {@spell harm|PC1} or heal on a single target and the target regains Hit Points from the spell, it also gains a +2 status bonus to AC and saving throws for 1 round.

feat.name: Domain Focus
entries: Your devotion to your deity's domains grows greater, and so does the power granted to you. Whenever you {@action Refocus|PC1}, completely refill your focus pool.

feat.name: Emblazon Antimagic
entries: Your deity's symbol protects against offensive magic. When you Emblazon an Armament, you can choose from the following effects instead of the effects listed in that feat. These effects have the same restrictions as the base options.

items: {@b Shield} When the wielder has the shield raised, they gain the shield's circumstance bonus to saving throws against magic, and they can use {@feat Shield Block|PC1} against damage from their enemies' spells.

{@b Weapon} When the weapon's wielder critically hits with the weapon, they can attempt to counteract a spell on their target, using half their level, rounded up, as the counteract rank. After the attempt, the emblazoned symbol immediately disappears.

feat.name: Fortunate Relief
entries: Your god favors your attempts to remove afflictions and conditions. When you cast a healing spell that attempts to counteract an effect, you can roll the counteract check twice and take the higher value.

feat.name: Sapping Symbol
feat.trigger: While you have your symbol raised, you are about to take damage from a melee attack.
entries: Your religious symbol glows with sacred energy, turning the attacker's strength to weakness. Attempt a {@skill Religion|PC1} check against the triggering creature's Will DC. Regardless of the result, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Success: The creature is {@condition enfeebled||enfeebled 2} until it spends at least 1 action moving away from you.

feat.name: Shared Replenishment
entries: When your deity blesses your warlike acts, you can extend that favor to your allies. You can grant the temporary Hit Points from {@feat Replenishment of War|PC1} to an ally within 10 feet instead of gaining them yourself. You can grant these temporary Hit Points to a different ally each time, meaning you might be able to grant them to multiple creatures in a single turn.

feat.name: Channeling Block
entries: You pour divine energy into a desperate block. When you {@feat Shield Block|PC1}, you can expend a {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} spell. Roll {@dice 1d8} for each rank of the spell, and increase the shield's Hardness by the total for this block.

feat.name: Deity's Protection
entries: When you call upon your deity's power to fulfill the promise of their domain, you gain divine protection. After you cast a domain spell, you gain resistance to all damage until the start of your next turn. The amount of resistance is equal to the rank of the domain spell you cast.

feat.name: Ebb and Flow
entries: You can pull forth both vitality and the void simultaneously to harm your enemies and heal your allies. If your next action is to cast a 1-action or 2-action {@spell heal|PC1} or {@spell harm|PC1} spell, choose one creature in range that would be harmed by the spell, and choose another creature within range that would be healed by the spell. Your {@spell heal|PC1} or {@spell harm|PC1} targets both creatures.

feat.name: Fast Channel
entries: Divine power is always at your fingertips, swiftly responding to your call. When you cast {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} by spending 2 actions, you can get the effects of the 3-action version instead of the 2-action version.
You can do this with {@spell harm|PC1} if you have harmful font or {@spell heal|PC1} if you have healing font (or both if you have {@feat Versatile Font|PC1}).

feat.name: Lasting Armament
entries: When you sanctify a weapon, it remains sanctified for an extended period. The duration of {@feat Sanctify Armament|PC1} is increased to 1 hour, but it still ends if you use {@feat Sanctify Armament|PC1} on another weapon.

feat.name: Premonition of Clarity
feat.trigger: You fail a saving throw against a {@trait mental} effect.
entries: Your deity sends you a vision of faith to steel you against mental attacks. Reroll the triggering saving throw with a +2 circumstance bonus. You must use the second result, even if it's worse.

feat.name: Swift Banishment
feat.trigger: You critically hit a creature that is not on its home plane.
feat.requirements: You have a {@spell banishment|PC1} spell prepared.
entries: The force of your blow sends your victim back to its home plane. You expend a {@spell banishment|PC1} spell you have prepared, affecting the creature you critically hit without needing to cast the spell. The creature can attempt to resist the spell as normal.

feat.name: Eternal Bane
entries: Your life has made you a nexus for your deity's vile power. You're continuously surrounded by a {@spell bane|PC1} spell, with a spell rank equal to half your level (rounded up). The radius is 15 feet, and you can't increase it. You can {@action Dismiss|PC1} the spell; if you do, it returns automatically after 1 minute.

feat.name: Eternal Blessing
entries: Your deeds have brought your deity's grace to you for all of eternity. You're continuously surrounded by a {@spell bless|PC1} spell, with a spell rank equal to half your level (rounded up). The radius is 15 feet, and you can't increase it. You can {@action Dismiss|PC1} the spell; if you do, it returns automatically after 1 minute.

feat.name: Rebounding Smite
feat.trigger: You miss with your {@action Strike|PC1} during {@feat Channel Smite|PC1}.
entries: The energy from your smite persists for a moment, allowing you to pass it to a new target. Cast the 1-action version of the {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} spell you expended, targeting a creature other than the target of your {@action Strike|PC1}.

feat.name: Remediate
entries: If your next action is to use your divine font to cast a 3-action {@spell heal|PC1} or {@spell harm|PC1} spell, you can harness the residual energy to counterbalance opposing forces. In addition to its normal effects, you use your {@spell heal|PC1} or {@spell harm|PC1} spell to attempt to counteract one {@trait divine|PC1} effect in the spell's area.

feat.name: Resurrectionist
entries: You can cause a creature you bring back from the brink of death to thrive and continue healing. When you restore Hit Points to a {@condition dying|PC1} creature or bring a dead creature back to life and restore Hit Points to it, you grant that creature fast healing 5 for 1 minute. This fast healing ends if the creature is knocked {@condition unconscious|PC1}.

feat.name: Divine Apex
entries: You can pour divine power into an item, letting the wearer exceed their limits. When you complete your daily preparations, you can touch one worn magical item that doesn't have the {@trait apex} trait. It gains the {@trait apex} trait until your next preparations, and you choose one of your deity's divine attributes. The item increases that attribute modifier by 1 or to +4, whichever is higher. A character can benefit from only one apex item at a time, as normal.

feat.name: Echoing Channel
entries: When you pull forth vitality or void energy, you also create a smaller pocket of that energy. If the next action you use is to cast a 2-action {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} to heal or damage a single creature, choose one additional creature in range. Target that creature with a 1-action version of the same spell. This spell is the same rank as the 2-action {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} you cast and doesn't cost another spell slot.

feat.name: Improved Swift Banishment
entries: You easily banish creatures with your weapon. You can use {@feat Swift Banishment|PC1} as long as you have a spell slot of 5th rank or higher remaining, even if you don't have {@spell banishment|PC1} prepared.

You must sacrifice a prepared spell of 5th rank or higher, and the {@spell banishment|PC1} effect you create is heightened to the rank of that spell. The target takes a –2 circumstance penalty to its save as though you'd paid the extra cost for {@spell banishment|PC1}.

feat.name: Inviolable
entries: Your deity punishes creatures that harm you. Creatures that hit you with an attack take {@damage 3d6} spirit damage every time they do. If you have the {@trait holy|PC1} or {@trait unholy|PC1} trait, you can apply it to this damage.

feat.name: Miraculous Possibility
entries: Your deity empowers you to perform minor miracles, allowing you to readily adapt to the fluctuating needs of your duties. Once during your daily preparations, you can use a spell slot to hold sheer divine potential, rather than using it to prepare a spell. You can use this spell slot to cast any spell you know from the divine spell list that's at least 2 ranks lower than the slot you designate. The spell acts in all ways as a spell of 2 ranks lower. You don't have any particular spell prepared in that slot until you cast it.

feat.name: Shared Clarity
entries: You can project your premonitions of clarity to your allies. When you use {@feat Premonition of Clarity|PC1}, allies within 15 feet of you who failed the same saving throw against the same {@trait mental} effect can also spend their reactions to reroll the failed saving throw with a +2 circumstance bonus.

feat.name: Avatar's Audience
entries: Your extensive service affords you certain divine privileges. First, any creature you encounter knows instinctively that you speak for your deity. Second, if you conduct the {@ritual commune|PC1} ritual to contact your deity, you don't have to pay any cost, and you automatically get a critical success. Third, once per day, you can cast {@spell interplanar teleport|PC1} as a divine innate spell, but only to travel to the realm of your deity. When you cast it this way, its casting time is 1 minute, your religious symbol is a sufficient planar key for this spell, and you appear exactly where you want to be. If you're in your deity's realm due to this spell, you can return to the point you left when you cast it by spending a single action, which has the {@trait concentrate} and {@trait divine} traits.

feat.name: Avatar's Protection
feat.trigger: You are critically hit by an enemy.
feat.requirements: You have an {@spell avatar|PC1} spell prepared.
entries: In moments of danger, you can call upon your god's form in an instant. You cast {@spell avatar|PC1} from your spell slots. The triggering critical hit is reduced to a normal hit, and its damage is applied after gaining the {@spell avatar|PC1} spell's temporary Hit Points.

feat.name: Maker of Miracles
entries: You are a conduit for truly deific power. You gain an additional 10th-rank spell slot.

feat.name: Spellshape Channel
entries: Deep understanding of divine revelations into the nature of vital essence allows you to freely manipulate the energy of life and death. Use one spellshape action you can perform that normally takes 1 action and can be applied to the {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} spell. If you use it in this way, its effects apply only to a {@spell harm|PC1} or {@spell heal|PC1} spell.

feat.name: Animal Companion
entries: You gain the service of a {@quickref young animal companion|PC1|0|young animal companions} that travels with you on your adventures and obeys any simple commands you give it to the best of its abilities.

feat.name: Animal Empathy
entries: You have a connection to the creatures of the natural world that allows you to communicate with them on a rudimentary level. You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the {@skill Diplomacy|PC1} skill with animals. In most cases, wild animals will give you time to make your case.

feat.name: Leshy Familiar
entries: You call a minor spirit of nature into a plant body, creating a leshy companion to aid you in your spellcasting. You gain a familiar, which has your choice of either the {@familiarAbility plant|PC1} or {@familiarAbility fungus|PC1} familiar ability; this doesn't count against your usual limit of familiar abilities (typically 2). The spirit you call has a more tenuous connection to its plant body than fully independent leshies, so it is Tiny in size like other familiars.

feat.name: Plant Empathy
entries: You have a connection to flora that allows you to communicate with them on a rudimentary level. You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the {@skill Diplomacy|PC1} skill with plants and fungus.

feat.name: Reach Spell
entries: You can extend the range of your spells. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet. If the spell normally has a range of touch, you extend its range to 30 feet.

feat.name: Storm Born
entries: You are at home out in the elements, reveling in the power of nature unleashed. You do not take circumstance penalties to ranged spell attacks or {@skill Perception|PC1} checks caused by weather, and your targeted spells don't require a flat check to succeed against a target {@condition concealed|PC1} by weather (such as fog).

feat.name: Verdant Weapon
entries: You cultivate a seed that can sprout into a wooden staff, vine whip, or another weapon. You spend 10 minutes focusing primal energy into a seed, imprinting it with the potential of a single level 0 weapon you are trained with and that has no mechanical parts or metal components. When holding the imprinted seed, you can use an {@action Interact|PC1} action to cause it to immediately grow into that weapon; a second {@action Interact|PC1} action returns it to seed form. The verdant weapon can be etched with runes or affixed with talismans as normal, which are suppressed when the weapon is in seed form.

You can have only one verdant seed at a time. If you prepare a second, your first verdant seed immediately becomes a mundane seed; any runes on the previous seed transfer to the new seed at no cost, but inapplicable runes are suppressed.

feat.name: Widen Spell
entries: You manipulate the energy of your spell, causing it to spread out and affect a wider area. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and does not have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

feat.name: Untamed Form
entries: You are one with the wild, always changing and adapting to meet any challenge. You gain the {@spell untamed form|PC1} order spell, which lets you transform into a variety of shapes that you can expand with druid feats.

feat.name: Call of the Wild
entries: You call upon the creatures of nature to come to your aid. You can spend 10 minutes in concert with nature to replace a spell you've prepared in one of your druid spell slots with a {@spell summon animal|PC1} or {@spell summon plant or fungus|PC1} spell of the same rank.

feat.name: Enhanced Familiar
entries: You infuse your familiar with additional primal energy, increasing its abilities. You can select four familiar or master abilities each day, instead of two.

feat.name: Order Explorer
entries: You have learned the secrets of another druidic order, passing whatever rites of initiation that order requires and gaining access to its secrets. Choose an order other than your own. You gain a 1st-level feat that lists that order as a prerequisite, and you are now a member of that order for the purpose of meeting feat prerequisites. If you commit acts anathema to your new order, you lose all feats and abilities requiring that order but retain your other druid feats and abilities. You don't gain any of the other benefits of the order you chose.
special: You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you do, you must choose a different order other than your own.

feat.name: Poison Resistance
entries: Your affinity for the natural world grants you protection against some of its dangers. You gain poison resistance equal to half your level, and you gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws against poisons.

feat.name: Anthropomorphic Shape
entries: Humanoids' supposed place apart from animals is folly—taking on their forms just requires some extra practice. You add the shapes listed in {@spell humanoid form|PC1} to your {@spell untamed form|PC1} list.

feat.name: Elemental Summons
entries: You can call the elements to you. You can spend 10 minutes in concert with nature to replace a spell you've prepared in one of your druid spell slots with a {@spell summon elemental|PC1} spell of the same rank.

feat.name: Forest Passage
entries: You can always find a path, almost as if foliage parted before you. You ignore any difficult terrain caused by plants and fungi, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth.

feat.name: Form Control
entries: With additional care and effort, you can take on an alternate shape for a longer period of time. If your next action is to cast {@spell untamed form|PC1}, the spell's rank is 2 lower than normal (minimum 1st rank), but you can remain transformed for up to 1 hour or the listed duration (whichever is longer). You can still {@action Dismiss|PC1} {@spell untamed form|PC1} as normal.

feat.name: Leshy Familiar Secrets
entries: The leaf order's secrets allow your familiar to take advantage of its leshy form. You can select one additional familiar ability each day, which must be one of the following leshy familiar abilities. You can't select more than one ability from this feat at a time.

items: {@b Grasping Tendrils} Your familiar can extend vines or similar tendrils, increasing its reach to 15 feet.

{@b Purify Air} Your familiar recycles air, providing enough oxygen for a Medium creature in areas with stale air, such as a sealed chamber or extradimensional space. Creatures within a 15-foot emanation of the leshy gain a +2 circumstance bonus to their saving throws against inhaled {@trait poison} effects, {@trait olfactory} effects, or other effects that rely on breathing (such as toxic cloud), at the GM's discretion.

{@b Verdant Burst} When your familiar dies, it releases its primal energy to cast the 3-action version of {@spell heal|PC1}, heightened to a rank 1 lower than your highest-rank spell slot. The {@spell heal|PC1} spell gains a status bonus equal to twice the spell's rank to the Hit Points it restores to plants. You must be able to cast 2nd-rank spells using spell slots to select this familiar ability.

feat.name: Mature Animal Companion
entries: Your animal companion has grown up over the course of your adventures, becoming a {@quickref specialized animal companion|PC1|0|Mature Animal Companions} and gaining additional capabilities.

Your animal companion has greater independence. During an encounter, even if you don't use the {@action Command an Animal|PC1} action, your animal companion can still use 1 action that round on your turn to {@action Stride|PC1} or {@action Strike|PC1}. It can do this at any point during your turn, as long as you aren't currently taking an action. If it does, that's all the actions it gets that round—you can't Command it later.

feat.name: Order Magic
entries: You have delved deeper into the teaching of a new order, gaining access to a coveted order spell. Choose an order you have selected with Order Explorer. You gain the initial order spell from that order.
special: You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you do, you must choose a different order you have selected with Order Explorer.

feat.name: Snowdrift Spell
entries: The howling wind and precipitation of your magic turn to thick snow. If your next action is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} that has the air, {@trait water}, or {@trait cold} trait, and that does not have the {@trait fire} trait, select one creature affected by the spell on the ground. Each square on the ground under or adjacent to the creature fills with ankle-deep snow. Those squares are difficult terrain until the beginning of your next turn. A creature can {@action Interact|PC1} to clear a square of snow, and the snow in a square melts if that square is exposed to a {@trait fire} effect.

feat.name: Current Spell
entries: As you use your magic to manipulate air or water, you spin off some of its currents to form a barrier around you. If your next action is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} with the {@trait air} or {@trait water} trait, until the start of your next turn, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC or a +2 circumstance bonus against ranged attacks. This effect has the {@trait air} or {@trait water} trait, or both, depending on the traits of the spell you cast. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to all saves against effects with the {@trait air} trait, {@trait water} trait, or both until the start of your next turn, depending on the spell's traits.

feat.name: Grown of Oak
entries: You can make your skin take on the woody endurance of an ancient tree and have your familiar follow suit. You can cast {@spell oaken resilience|PC1} at will as an innate primal spell with a spell rank one lower than the highest rank of spells you can cast.
This spell targets you, as well as your leshy familiar if it's within 30 feet of you.

feat.name: Insect Shape
entries: Your understanding of life expands, allowing you to mimic a wider range of creatures. Add the shapes in {@spell insect form|PC1} to your {@spell untamed form|PC1} list. Whenever you use untamed form to polymorph into the non-flying insect shapes listed in {@spell pest form|PC1}, the duration is 24 hours instead of 10 minutes.

feat.name: Instinctive Support
feat.trigger: You Cast a non-cantrip spell that targets only your animal companion.
entries: When you support your animal companion, your companion supports you in turn. After your spell takes place, your companion gains its actions for the turn, as if you Commanded it, and one of the actions must be Support. If the companion has used any other actions already, it can't Support you, as normal.

feat.name: Steady Spellcasting
entries: Confident in your technique, you don't lose spells easily. If a reaction would disrupt your spellcasting action, attempt a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check. If you succeed, your action isn't disrupted.

feat.name: Storm Retribution
feat.prerequisites: storm order, {@spell tempest surge|PC1} order spell
feat.trigger: An opponent adjacent to you critically hits you with a melee weapon or melee unarmed attack.
feat.requirements: You have at least 1 available Focus Point.
entries: You lash out, directing a burst of storming fury toward a creature that has harmed you. You cast {@spell tempest surge|PC1} on the triggering opponent and push that creature, moving it 5 feet away from you if it fails its Reflex save, or 10 feet if it critically fails. This movement is forced movement.

feat.name: Deimatic Display
entries: Imitating animal threat displays, you make yourself appear larger and more imposing. Roll one {@skill Intimidation|PC1} check to {@action Demoralize|PC1} and compare the result to the Will DC of each animal, {@trait fungus}, and {@trait plant} creature in a 15-foot cone. When you do, {@action Demoralize|PC1} gains the {@trait visual} trait, and creatures are not affected if they can see you. You don't take a penalty if the creature doesn't understand your language.

feat.name: Ferocious Shape
entries: You've mastered the shape of dinosaurs. Add the shapes listed in {@spell dinosaur form|PC1} to your {@spell untamed form|PC1} list. Whenever you use untamed form to take a shape that grants you a specific {@skill Athletics|PC1} modifier, you gain a +1 status bonus to your {@skill Athletics|PC1} checks.

feat.name: Fey Caller
entries: You have learned some of the tricks the fey use to bend primal magic toward illusions and trickery. Add {@spell illusory disguise|PC1}, {@spell illusory object|PC1}, and {@spell illusory scene|PC1} to your spell list, which you cast as primal spells.

feat.name: Floral Restoration
entries: You request that nearby plants share their vitality with you to replenish your body and magic. You regain 1 Focus Point and {@dice 4d8} Hit Points.

You must be in a location of at least 15 square feet with healthy plant life, though this can be grass, lichen, seaweed, or any other form of naturally occurring flora. Using Floral Restoration on a given section of nature does not harm it, but it prevents that section of nature from giving its vitality to another use of Floral Restoration for 24 hours.
At 9th level, and every 2 levels thereafter, increase the healing by {@dice 1d8}.

feat.name: Incredible Companion
entries: Your animal companion continues to grow and develop. It becomes either a {@companionAbility nimble|PC1} or {@companionAbility savage|PC1} animal companion, gaining additional capabilities determined by the type.

feat.name: Raise Menhir
entries: You raise a druidic monument, such as a standing stone or warding tree, from the ground, creating a powerful primal ward that blocks other types of magic. The monument appears in an unoccupied square on the ground within 30 feet, making that square difficult terrain. Choose arcane, divine, or occult; all creatures within 15 feet of the monument gain a +2 status bonus to their saving throws against effects with that trait. The monument lasts for 1 round before crumbling back into the earth or wilting away into nothingness, but you can Sustain the monument for up to 1 minute.

feat.name: Soaring Shape
entries: Wings free you from the shackles of the ground below. Add the bat and bird shapes in {@spell aerial form|PC1} to your untamed form list. If you have {@feat Insect Shape|PC1}, you also add the wasp shape to your untamed form list. If you have {@feat Ferocious Shape|PC1}, you also add the pterosaur shape to your {@spell untamed form|PC1} list. Whenever you use {@spell untamed form|PC1} to take a shape that grants you a specific {@skill Acrobatics|PC1} modifier, you gain a +1 status bonus to {@skill Acrobatics|PC1} checks.

feat.name: Wind Caller
entries: You bid the winds to aid you, carrying you through the air and allowing you passage through the strongest headwinds. You gain the {@spell stormwind flight|PC1} order spell.

feat.name: Elemental Shape
entries: You understand the fundamental elements of nature such that you can imbue them into your body and manifest as a living embodiment of those elements. Add the shapes in {@spell elemental form|PC1} to your {@spell untamed form|PC1} list. Whenever you're polymorphed into another shape using {@spell untamed form|PC1}, you gain resistance 5 to fire.

feat.name: Healing Transformation
entries: You can take advantage of shapechanging magic to close wounds and patch injuries. If your next action is to cast a noncantrip polymorph spell that targets only one creature, your polymorph spell also restores {@dice 1d6} Hit Points per spell rank to that creature. This is a {@trait healing} effect.

feat.name: Overwhelming Energy
entries: With a complex gesture, you call upon the primal power of your spell to overcome enemies' resistances. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1}, the spell ignores an amount of the target's resistance to acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage equal to your level. This applies to all damage the spell deals, including {@condition persistent damage|PC1} and damage caused by an ongoing effect of the spell, such as the wall created by wall of fire. A creature's immunities are unaffected.

feat.name: Plant Shape
entries: You can take the shape of a {@trait plant} creature. If you don't have {@spell untamed form|PC1}, you can cast {@spell plant form|PC1} once per day, heightened to the same rank as your highest-rank druid spell slot.

If you do have {@spell untamed form|PC1}, add the shapes listed in {@spell plant form|PC1} to your {@spell untamed form|PC1} list, and whenever you're polymorphed into another shape using {@spell untamed form|PC1}, you gain resistance 5 to poison.

feat.name: Primal Howl
entries: Your companion can let out a howl laced with your primal magic. It gains the following advanced maneuver, in addition to any advanced maneuvers it already knows.

entries.name: Primal Howl
entries: Your familiar screeches and howls, empowered with natural magic. All creatures in a 30-foot cone take {@damage 1d6} sonic damage for every 2 levels your companion has, with a basic Fortitude save against your spell DC. Creatures that fail become {@condition frightened||frightened 1}, and creatures that critically fail become {@condition frightened||frightened 2}. The fright is an emotion, {@trait fear}, and {@trait mental} effect.

feat.name: Pristine Weapon
entries: Your verdant weapon can cut through the resistances of {@trait magical} creatures. The weapon is treated as cold iron and silver. If you critically hit a creature that has a weakness to cold iron or silver, the target takes {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage|PC1|persistent bleed damage} as the primal energies within your weapon slow its natural healing.

feat.name: Side by Side
entries: You and your animal companion fight in tandem, distracting your foes and keeping them off balance. Whenever you and your animal companion are adjacent to the same foe, you are both flanking that foe with each other, regardless of your actual positions.

feat.name: Thunderclap Spell
entries: Your lightning splits the air, generating a booming shock wave. If your next action is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} that has the {@trait electricity} trait or deals electricity damage, has no duration, and requires creatures to attempt a saving throw, the force of the spell's lightning creates a thunderclap, in addition to its other effects. Each creature that failed its Reflex save against the spell is {@condition deafened|PC1} for 1 round, and those who critically failed are also knocked {@condition prone|PC1}.

feat.name: Dragon Shape
entries: You can take on the shape of some of the world's most fearsome creatures. Add the shapes listed in {@spell dragon form|PC1} to your {@spell untamed form|PC1} list. Whenever you're polymorphed into another shape using {@spell untamed form|PC1}, you gain resistance 5 to your choice of acid, cold, electricity, fire, or poison.

feat.name: Garland Spell
entries: If your next action is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} with the {@trait fungus} or {@trait plant} trait, a garland of plants grows in a 10-foot burst in the spell's range. The plants are difficult terrain and hazardous terrain, covered in your choice of thorns or poisonous vines. Any creature that moves into one of these squares or ends its turn in one takes {@dice 2d6} damage (piercing damage for thorns or poison for vines). A creature can take this damage only once per turn. You and your familiar are immune to this damage.
The plants last for 1 minute or until you cast another Garland Spell, whichever comes first.
The damage increases to {@dice 3d6} at 16th level and {@dice 4d6} at 20th level.

feat.name: Primal Focus
entries: Your connection to nature is particularly strong, and the spirits of nature flock around you, helping you replenish your focus. Whenever you {@action Refocus|PC1}, completely refill your focus pool.

feat.name: Primal Summons
entries: Whenever you summon an ally, you can empower it with the elemental power of air, earth, fire, or water. You gain the {@spell primal summons|PC1} order spell.

feat.name: Wandering Oasis
entries: You're surrounded by soothing energy. You and allies within 60 feet of you are protected from severe environmental heat and cold. If you're legendary in {@skill Survival|PC1}, you and those allies are also protected from extreme environmental heat and cold.

feat.name: Reactive Transformation
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Untamed Form|PC1}; {@feat Dragon Shape|PC1}, {@feat Elemental Shape|PC1}, {@feat Plant Shape|PC1}, or {@feat Soaring Shape|PC1}
feat.trigger: varies
entries: You transform reflexively when in danger. You cast {@spell untamed form|PC1} to transform into one shape granted by one of the prerequisite feats you have, depending on the trigger. Your shape's resistances and weaknesses apply against the triggering damage.

items: {@bold Trigger} You fall 10 feet or more; {@b Effect} Choose a form from {@spell aerial form|PC1}.
{@bold Trigger} You take acid, cold, electricity, fire, or poison damage; {@b Effect} Choose a form from {@spell dragon form|PC1} that resists the triggering damage.
{@bold Trigger} You take fire damage; {@b Effect} Choose a fire elemental form from {@spell elemental form|PC1}.
{@bold Trigger} You take poison damage; {@b Effect} Choose a form from {@spell plant form|PC1}.

feat.name: Sow Spell
entries: You fold your spell into a seed. If your next action is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} using 1 action or 2 actions, the spell instead plants itself in an adjacent square. You must make all decisions regarding the spell at the time you cast it. Within the next 10 minutes, you can direct your sown spell to sprout and produce the spell's effects as a reaction, which is triggered when a creature enters the sown spell's space or a square adjacent to it. You can have only one sown spell at a time, and if you don't trigger the spell within 10 minutes, it dissipates and the spell is lost. A creature can notice the sown spell with a successful {@skill Perception|PC1} check against your spell DC.

feat.name: Specialized Companion
entries: Your animal companion continues to grow in power and ability. It gains one specialization of your choice.
special: You can select this feat up to three times. Each time, add a different specialization to your companion.

feat.name: Timeless Nature
entries: With primal magic sustaining you, you cease aging. The overflowing primal energy gives you a +2 status bonus to saves against diseases and primal magic.

feat.name: Verdant Metamorphosis
entries: You have turned into a plant version of yourself, gaining the {@trait plant} trait and losing traits inappropriate for your new form (typically humanoid). You also gain the Verdant Rest action.

Verdant Rest {@as 1} (concentrate) You turn into a tree or other noncreature plant. This has the effect of using one with plants to turn into a plant, except that your AC is 30. You can {@action Dismiss|PC1} this effect to turn back. If you rest for 10 minutes in this form in natural sunlight, you recover half your maximum Hit Points. If you take your daily rest in this form, the rest restores you to maximum Hit Points and removes all non-permanent {@condition drained|PC1}, {@condition enfeebled|PC1}, {@condition clumsy|PC1}, and {@condition stupefied|PC1} conditions, as well as all poisons and diseases of 19th level or lower.

feat.name: Effortless Concentration
feat.trigger: Your turn begins.
entries: You maintain a spell with hardly a thought. You immediately gain the effects of the Sustain action, allowing you to extend the duration of one of your active druid spells.

feat.name: Impaling Briars
entries: You can fill an area with devastating briars. You gain the {@spell impaling briars|PC1} order spell.

feat.name: Monstrosity Shape
entries: You can transform into a powerful {@trait magical} creature. Add the cave worm and sea serpent shapes listed in {@spell monstrosity form|PC1} to your {@spell untamed form|PC1} list. If you have {@feat Soaring Shape|PC1}, also add the phoenix shape to your {@spell untamed form|PC1} list.

feat.name: Uplifting Winds
entries: The winds are eager to keep you aloft. When you are flying and {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} that has the {@trait air} or {@trait electricity} traits, you gain a +10 status bonus to your fly Speed, and you can immediately {@action Fly|PC1} up to half your Speed.

feat.name: Invoke Disaster
entries: You can invoke nature's fury upon your foes. You gain the {@spell storm lord|PC1} order spell.

feat.name: Perfect Form Control
entries: Thanks to magic and muscle memory, you can stay in your alternate shapes indefinitely. When you use Form Control, instead of lasting 1 hour, untamed form's duration is unlimited (you can still {@action Dismiss|PC1} it).

feat.name: Primal Aegis
entries: You surround yourself with a thick field of protective primal energy. You and allies within 30 feet of you gain resistance equal to your Wisdom modifier to acid, cold, electricity, fire, vitality, and void damage.

feat.name: Hierophant's Power
entries: You have entwined yourself with the natural world, and its full power flows through you. You gain an additional 10th-rank spell slot.

feat.name: Ley Line Conduit
entries: You can draw magic from the ley lines of the world. If your next action is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} of 5th rank or lower that has no duration, you don't expend the prepared spell as you cast it.

feat.name: True Shapeshifter
entries: You transcend the limitations of form. Once per day you can cast {@spell nature incarnate|PC1}, even if you don't have it prepared, to transform into a kaiju. If you have {@feat Plant Shape|PC1}, you can choose to transform into a green man instead. You also gain the True Shapeshift activity.

entries.name: True Shapeshift
entries.requirements: You're under the effects of untamed form
entries: You change into any other shape on your untamed form list. If the duration of that shape is different from the one you were previously in, use the shorter duration to determine your duration remaining.

feat.name: Combat Assessment
entries: You make a telegraphed attack to learn about your foe. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1}. On a hit, you can immediately attempt a check to {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1} about the target. On a critical hit, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the check to {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1}. The target is temporarily immune to Combat Assessment for 1 day.

feat.name: Double Slice
feat.requirements: You are wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand.
entries: You lash out at your foe with both weapons. Make two Strikes, one with each of your two melee weapons, each using your current multiple attack penalty. Both Strikes must have the same target. If the second {@action Strike|PC1} is made with a weapon that doesn't have the {@trait agile} trait, it takes a –2 penalty. If both attacks hit, combine their damage, and then add any other applicable effects from both weapons. You add any precision damage only once, to the attack of your choice. Combine the damage from both Strikes and apply resistances and weaknesses only once. This counts as two attacks when calculating your multiple attack penalty.

feat.name: Exacting Strike
entries: You make a {@condition controlled|PC1} follow-up attack, fully accounting for your momentum. Make a {@action Strike|PC1}. The {@action Strike|PC1} gains the following failure effect.

Failure: This attack doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty.

feat.name: Point Blank Stance
feat.requirements: You are wielding a ranged weapon.
entries: You take aim to pick off nearby enemies quickly. When using a ranged volley weapon while you are in this stance, you don't take the penalty to your attack rolls from the {@trait volley} trait. When using a ranged weapon that doesn't have the {@trait volley} trait, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls on attacks against targets within the weapon's first range increment.

feat.name: Reactive Shield
feat.trigger: An enemy hits you with a melee {@action Strike|PC1}.
feat.requirements: You are wielding a shield.
entries: You can snap your shield into place just as you would take a blow, avoiding the hit at the last second. You immediately use the {@action Raise a Shield|PC1} action and gain your shield's bonus to AC. The circumstance bonus from the shield applies to your AC when you're determining the outcome of the triggering attack.

feat.name: Snagging Strike
