feat.requirements: You have one hand free, and your target is within reach of that hand.
entries: You combine an attack with quick grappling moves to throw an enemy off balance as long as it stays in your reach. Make a Strike while keeping one hand free. If this Strike hits, the target is {@condition off-guard|PC1} until the start of your next turn or until it's no longer within the reach of your hand, whichever comes first.

feat.name: Sudden Charge
entries: With a quick sprint, you dash up to your foe and swing. {@action Stride|PC1} twice. If you end your movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, you can make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} against that enemy.
You can use Sudden Charge while Burrowing, Climbing, Flying, or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

feat.name: Vicious Swing
entries: You unleash a particularly powerful attack that clobbers your foe but leaves you a bit unsteady. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1}. This counts as two attacks when calculating your multiple attack penalty. If this {@action Strike|PC1} hits, you deal an extra die of weapon damage. If you're at least 10th level, increase this to two extra dice, and if you're at least 18th level, increase it to three extra dice.

feat.name: Aggressive Block
feat.trigger: You use the {@feat Shield Block|PC1} reaction, and the opponent that triggered {@feat Shield Block|PC1} is adjacent to you and is your size or smaller.
entries: You push back as you block, knocking your foe away or off balance. You use your shield to push the triggering creature, either automatically {@action Shove||Shoving} it 5 feet or causing it to become {@condition off-guard|PC1} until the start of your next turn. The triggering creature chooses whether to be moved or become {@condition off-guard|PC1}. If it chooses to be moved, you choose the direction. If the {@action Shove|PC1} would cause it to hit a solid object, enter a square of difficult terrain, or enter another creature's space, it must become {@condition off-guard|PC1} instead of being moved.

feat.name: Assisting Shot
feat.requirements: You are wielding a ranged weapon.
entries: Using your last shot to gauge your accuracy, you can fire off a quick shot to interfere with a foe in combat. Make a {@action Strike|PC1} with a ranged weapon. If the {@action Strike|PC1} hits, the next creature other than you to attack the same target before the start of your next turn gains a +1 circumstance bonus to their roll, or a +2 circumstance bonus if your {@action Strike|PC1} was a critical hit.

feat.name: Blade Brake
feat.trigger: You would be moved by a forced movement effect.
feat.requirements: You are wielding a melee weapon and are within reach of a hard surface.
entries: You plow your weapon into a floor, wall, or another sturdy surface, anchoring yourself in place. If you would be moved 20 feet or more, you are moved only 5 feet. Otherwise, you don't move at all.

feat.name: Brutish Shove
feat.requirements: You are wielding a two-handed melee weapon.
entries: Using the momentum of your last attack to throw your weight into another, you make your opponent stumble back. Make a {@action Strike|PC1} with a two-handed melee weapon. If you hit a target that is your size or smaller, that creature is {@condition off-guard|PC1} until the end of your current turn, and you can automatically {@action Shove|PC1} it, with the same benefits as the {@action Shove|PC1} action (including the critical success effect, if your {@action Strike|PC1} was a critical hit). If you move to follow the target, your movement doesn't trigger reactions.
This {@action Strike|PC1} has the following failure effect.

Failure: The target becomes {@condition off-guard|PC1} until the end of your current turn.}

feat.name: Combat Grab
feat.requirements: You have one hand free, and your target is within reach of that hand.
entries: Using your prior attack to shift your opponent's guard, you take another swing and grab them. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} while keeping one hand free. If the {@action Strike|PC1} hits, you grab the target using your free hand. The creature remains {@condition grabbed|PC1} until the end of your next turn or until it {@action Escape||Escapes}, whichever comes first.

feat.name: Dueling Parry
feat.requirements: You are wielding a single one-handed melee weapon and hold nothing else in your hands.
entries: You can parry attacks against you with your one-handed weapon. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn as long as you continue to meet the requirements.

feat.name: Intimidating Strike
entries: Your blow not only wounds creatures but also shatters their confidence. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1}. If you hit and deal damage, the target is {@condition frightened||frightened 1}, or {@condition frightened||frightened 2} on a critical hit.

feat.name: Lightning Swap
entries: You have practiced quickly switching between combat styles and the equipment needed for them. You {@action Interact|PC1} to stow any number of items from your hands, then draw up to two weapons or a shield and a weapon.

feat.name: Lunge
feat.requirements: You are wielding a melee weapon.
entries: You attack an enemy at the edge of your reach. Make a {@action Strike|PC1} with a melee weapon, increasing your reach by 5 feet for that {@action Strike|PC1}. If the weapon has the {@trait disarm}, {@trait shove}, or {@trait trip} trait, you can use the corresponding action instead of a {@action Strike|PC1}.

feat.name: Rebounding Toss
feat.requirements: You are wielding a thrown weapon.
entries: You bounce your weapon off one foe to strike another. Make a ranged {@action Strike|PC1} with a thrown weapon. If this {@action Strike|PC1} hits, the weapon rebounds toward an enemy within 10 feet of the original target. Make an additional {@action Strike|PC1} against this second target. Both attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after you've made both attacks.

feat.name: Sleek Reposition
feat.requirements: You are wielding a finesse weapon or polearm.
entries: While your opponent is still recovering from your prior attack, you snag its armor, clothing, or flesh to move it as you please. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} with a finesse weapon or polearm. If you hit a target that is your size or smaller, you can automatically {@action Reposition|PC1} it, with the same benefits as the {@action Reposition|PC1} action (including the critical success effect, if your {@action Strike|PC1} was a critical hit). If you used a weapon with reach, use the weapon's reach for this {@action Reposition|PC1}.
This {@action Strike|PC1} has the following failure effect.

Failure: The target becomes {@condition off-guard|PC1} until the end of your current turn.

feat.name: Barreling Charge
entries: You rush forward, moving enemies aside to reach your foe. You {@action Stride|PC1}, attempting to move through your enemies' spaces, and make a melee {@action Strike|PC1}. Roll an {@skill Athletics|PC1} check and compare the result to the Fortitude DC of each creature whose space you attempt to move through during your {@action Stride|PC1}, moving through their space on a success but ending your movement before entering their space on a failure. You can use Barreling Charge to {@action Burrow|PC1}, {@action Climb|PC1}, {@action Fly|PC1}, or {@action Swim|PC1} instead of {@action Stride|PC1} if you have the corresponding movement type.

feat.name: Double Shot
feat.requirements: You are wielding a ranged weapon with reload 0.
entries: You shoot twice in blindingly fast succession. Make two {@action Strike||Strikes}, each against a separate target and with a –2 penalty. Both attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after you've made both of them.

feat.name: Dual-Handed Assault
feat.requirements: You are wielding a one-handed melee weapon and have a free hand.
entries: You snap your free hand over to grip your weapon just long enough to add momentum and deliver a more powerful blow to your opponent. Make a {@action Strike|PC1} with the required weapon. You quickly switch your grip during the {@action Strike|PC1} in order to make the attack with two hands. If the weapon doesn't normally have the {@trait two-hand} trait, increase its weapon damage die by one step for this attack. If the weapon has the {@trait two-hand} trait, you gain the benefit of that trait and a circumstance bonus to damage equal to the weapon's number of damage dice. When the {@action Strike|PC1} is complete, you resume gripping the weapon with only one hand. This action doesn't end any stance or fighter feat effect that requires you to have one hand free.

feat.name: Parting Shot
feat.requirements: You are wielding a loaded ranged weapon or a ranged weapon with reload 0.
entries: You jump back and make a quick shot that catches your opponent by surprise. You {@action Step|PC1} and then make a ranged {@action Strike|PC1} with the required weapon. Your target is {@condition off-guard|PC1} against the attack.}

feat.name: Powerful Shove
entries: You can push larger foes around with your attack. You can use {@feat Aggressive Block|PC1} or {@feat Brutish Shove|PC1} against a creature up to two sizes larger than you.

When a creature you {@action Shove|PC1} or knock back with a shield, polearm, or club's critical specialization effect has to stop moving because it would hit an object, it takes damage equal to your Strength modifier (minimum 1).

feat.name: Quick Reversal
feat.requirements: You are flanked by at least two enemies.
entries: You turn your foes' flanking against them with a quick reverse. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} against one of the flanking enemies and make a second {@action Strike|PC1} with the same weapon or unarmed attack against a different enemy that is flanking you. This second {@action Strike|PC1} has the same multiple attack penalty of the initial attack and doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty.

feat.name: Shielded Stride
entries: When your shield is up, your enemies' blows can't touch you. When you have your shield raised, you can {@action Stride|PC1} to move half your Speed without triggering reactions that are triggered by your movement (such as Reactive Strikes). You can use Shielded {@action Stride|PC1} while Flying or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

feat.name: Slam Down
entries: You make an attack to knock a foe off balance, then follow up immediately with a sweep to topple them. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1}. If it hits and deals damage, you can attempt an {@skill Athletics|PC1} check to {@action Trip|PC1} the creature you hit. If you're wielding a two-handed melee weapon, you can ignore {@action Trip|PC1}'s requirement that you have a hand free. Both attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after you've made both of them.

feat.name: Swipe
entries: You make a wide, arcing swing. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} and compare the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within your melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature you hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for your multiple attack penalty.
If you're using a weapon with the {@trait sweep} trait, its modifier applies to all your Swipe attacks.

feat.name: Twin Parry
feat.requirements: You are wielding two melee weapons, one in each hand.
entries: You use your two weapons to parry attacks. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, or a +2 circumstance bonus if either weapon has the {@trait parry} trait.
You lose this circumstance bonus if you no longer meet this feat's requirement.

feat.name: Advanced Weapon Training
entries: You've studied the art of wielding an advanced weapon. Choose a weapon group. You gain proficiency with all advanced weapons in that group as if they were martial weapons of their weapon group.

feat.name: Advantageous Assault
entries: After compromising your enemy's movement, you deliver a more deadly blow. Make a {@action Strike|PC1} against a creature that is {@condition grabbed|PC1}, {@condition prone|PC1}, or {@condition restrained|PC1}. You gain a circumstance bonus to damage on this {@action Strike|PC1} equal to the number of weapon damage dice, or that number + 2 if you're wielding the weapon in two hands. The {@action Strike|PC1} gains the following failure effect.

Failure: You deal damage to the target equal to the number of weapon damage dice, or that number + 2 if you're wielding the weapon in two hands. This damage has the same damage type as the weapon.

feat.name: Dazing Blow
feat.requirements: You have a creature {@condition grabbed|PC1}.
entries: You pummel a held foe, hoping to stagger them. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} against a creature you have {@condition grabbed|PC1}. The weapon damage from this {@action Strike|PC1} is bludgeoning damage. If the {@action Strike|PC1} hits, the creature must attempt a Fortitude save against your class DC; this is an {@trait incapacitation} effect.

feat.name: Disarming Stance
feat.requirements: You are wielding a single one-handed melee weapon and hold nothing else in your hands.
entries: You adopt a fencing stance that improves your control over your weapon. While you are in this stance, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to {@skill Athletics|PC1}} checks to {@action Disarm|PC1}} and a +2 circumstance bonus to your Reflex DC when defending against checks to {@action Disarm|PC1}} you. In addition, you can attempt to {@action Disarm|PC1} creatures up to two sizes larger than you.

feat.name: Furious Focus
entries: You've learned to maintain your balance even when swinging furiously. When you make a {@feat Vicious Swing|PC1} with a melee weapon you're wielding in two hands, it counts as one attack toward your multiple attack penalty instead of two.

feat.name: Guardian's Deflection
feat.trigger: An ally within your melee reach is hit by an attack, you can see the attacker, and the ally gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC would turn the critical hit into a hit or the hit into a miss.
feat.requirements: You are wielding a single one-handed melee weapon and hold nothing else in your hands.
entries: You use your weapon to deflect the attack against your ally, granting a +2 circumstance bonus to their Armor Class against the triggering attack. This turns the triggering critical hit into a hit, or the triggering hit into a miss.

feat.name: Reflexive Shield
entries: You can use your shield to fend off explosions and the like. When you {@action Raise a Shield||Raise your Shield}, you gain your shield's circumstance bonus to Reflex saves.
special: If you have the {@feat Shield Block|PC1} reaction, damage you take as a result of a Reflex save can trigger that reaction, even if the damage isn't physical damage.

feat.name: Revealing Stab
feat.requirements: You are wielding a melee weapon that can deal piercing damage.
entries: You drive your piercing weapon into an imperceptible foe, revealing its location to your allies. Make a {@action Strike|PC1} with a piercing melee weapon. If the target is {@condition concealed|PC1}, you don't need to attempt a flat check to target it, and if it's {@condition hidden|PC1}, the DC of the flat check to target it is 5. If you hit and deal damage, you can drive the weapon you attacked with into the target (if it's corporeal), revealing its current position. You {@action Release|PC1} the weapon, and it becomes lodged in the target. If the target is {@condition concealed|PC1}, no flat check is needed to target it, and if it's {@condition hidden|PC1}, the DC of the flat check to target it is 5, and the creature can't become {@condition undetected|PC1}. These benefits apply only for observers who can see your weapon stuck in the target. If the target is {@condition invisible|PC1}, the weapon remains visible while lodged in it.
This benefit lasts until the weapon is removed from the creature. An adjacent creature or the target can remove the weapon with two {@action Interact|PC1} actions.

feat.name: Ricochet Stance
entries: You adopt a stance to rebound your thrown weapons toward you. While you are in this stance, any thrown weapons you use as part of a ranged {@action Strike|PC1} to deal bludgeoning or slashing damage immediately return to your hand, enabling you to use them for additional Strikes. You must be within the weapon's listed range increment and have a hand free to catch the weapon. If you make a ranged {@action Strike|PC1} with a thrown weapon outside of its listed range increment, it instead flies back toward you a number of feet equal to its listed range increment and then falls to the ground.

feat.name: Shatter Defenses
feat.requirements: A {@condition frightened|PC1} creature is in your melee reach.
entries: Your offense exploits your enemy's fear. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} against a {@condition frightened|PC1} creature. If you hit and deal damage, the target becomes {@condition off-guard|PC1} until its {@condition frightened|PC1} condition ends. If the target was already {@condition off-guard|PC1} to you when you damaged it with this {@action Strike|PC1}, it can't reduce its {@condition frightened|PC1} value below 1 until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Shield Warden
entries: When you have a shield raised, you can use your {@feat Shield Block|PC1} reaction when an attack is made against an ally adjacent to you. If you do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of preventing you from taking damage, following the normal rules for {@feat Shield Block|PC1}.

feat.name: Triple Shot
entries: You can quickly fire multiple shots with greater control. When you use {@feat Double Shot|PC1}, you can make the attacks against the same target. You can add an additional action to {@feat Double Shot|PC1} to make three ranged Strikes instead of two. If you do, the penalty is –4. All attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after you've made all of them.

feat.name: Blind-Fight
entries: Your battle instincts make you more aware of {@condition concealed|PC1} and {@condition invisible|PC1} opponents. You don't need to succeed at a flat check to target {@condition concealed|PC1} creatures. You're not {@condition off-guard|PC1} to creatures that are hidden from you (unless you're {@condition off-guard|PC1} to them for reasons other than the hidden condition), and you need only a successful DC {@flatDC 5} flat check to target a {@condition hidden|PC1} creature.
While you're adjacent to an {@condition undetected|PC1} creature of your level or lower, it is instead only {@condition hidden|PC1} from you.

feat.name: Disorienting Opening
entries: You use your foes' openings to expose even greater weaknesses. When you hit a creature as part of a {@action Reactive Strike|PC1}, that creature becomes {@condition off-guard|PC1} until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Dueling Riposte
feat.trigger: A creature within your reach critically fails a {@action Strike|PC1} against you.
feat.requirements: You are benefiting from {@feat Dueling Parry|PC1}.
entries: You elegantly counterattack against your flailing enemy. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} against or attempt to {@action Disarm|PC1} the triggering creature.

feat.name: Felling Strike
entries: Your attack can ground an airborne foe. Make a {@action Strike|PC1}. If it hits and deals damage to a flying target, the target falls up to 120 feet. The fall is gradual enough that if it causes the target to hit the ground, the target takes no damage from the fall.
If the attack is a critical hit, the target can't {@action Fly|PC1}, {@action Leap|PC1}, levitate, or otherwise leave the ground until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Incredible Aim
entries: By spending a moment to focus, you can ensure your attack strikes true. Make a ranged weapon {@action Strike|PC1}. On this {@action Strike|PC1}, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll and ignore the target's {@condition concealed|PC1} condition.

feat.name: Mobile Shot Stance
entries: Your shots become nimble and deadly. While you're in this stance, your ranged Strikes don't trigger {@action Reactive Strike|PC1} or other reactions that are triggered by a ranged attack.
special: If you have {@action Reactive Strike|PC1}, you can use it with a loaded ranged weapon you're wielding. The triggering creature must be within 5 feet of you for you to do so.

feat.name: Positioning Assault
feat.requirements: You are wielding a two-handed melee weapon and your target is within your reach.
entries: With punishing blows, you force your opponent into position. Make a {@action Strike|PC1} with the required weapon. If you hit, you {@action Reposition|PC1} the target 5 feet.

feat.name: Quick Shield Block
entries: You can bring your shield into place with hardly a thought. At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to {@feat Shield Block|PC1}.

feat.name: Resounding Bravery
entries: Even your fears serve as fuel for your fighting spirit. When you critically succeed at a Will save against a foe's ability, you gain a +1 status bonus to saves and a number of temporary Hit Points equal to half your level for 1 minute. These benefits are doubled if you critically succeed against a {@trait fear} effect

feat.name: Sudden Leap
entries: You make an impressive leap and swing while you soar. Make a {@action Leap|PC1}, {@action High Jump|PC1}, or {@action Long Jump|PC1} and attempt one melee {@action Strike|PC1} at any point during your jump. Immediately after the {@action Strike|PC1}, you fall to the ground if you're in the air, even if you haven't reached the maximum distance of your jump. If the distance you fall is no more than the height of your jump, you take no damage and land upright.

When attempting a {@action High Jump|PC1} or {@action Long Jump|PC1} during a Sudden Leap, determine the DC using the {@action Long Jump|PC1} DCs, and increase your maximum distance to double your Speed.
special: If you have {@feat Felling Strike|PC1}, you can use {@feat Felling Strike|PC1} instead of a normal {@action Strike|PC1}. This doesn't change the number of actions Sudden Leap takes.

feat.name: Agile Grace
entries: Your graceful moves with agile weapons are beyond compare. Your multiple attack penalty with {@trait agile} weapons and {@trait agile} unarmed attacks becomes –3 for your second attack and –6 for subsequent attacks (rather than –4 and –8).

feat.name: Certain Strike
entries: Even when you don't hit squarely, you can still score a glancing blow. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1}. It gains the following failure effect.

Failure: Your attack deals any damage it would have dealt on a hit, excluding all damage dice. (This removes damage dice from weapon runes, spells, and special abilities, in addition to weapon damage dice.)

feat.name: Crashing Slam
entries: You can dash your foe to the ground with a single blow. When you use {@feat Slam Down|PC1}, instead of making a {@action Strike|PC1} followed by a {@action Trip|PC1}, you can attempt a single {@action Strike|PC1}. If you do and your {@action Strike|PC1} hits, instead of rolling a check for your {@action Trip|PC1} attempt, you automatically apply the critical success effect of a {@action Trip|PC1}.
If you used a two-handed melee weapon for the {@action Strike|PC1}, you can use the weapon's damage die size instead of the regular die size for the damage from a critical {@action Trip|PC1}.

feat.name: Cut from the Air
feat.trigger: You are the target of a physical ranged {@action Strike|PC1}.
feat.requirements: You're aware of the attack, not {@condition off-guard|PC1} against it, and either have a hand free or are wielding a melee weapon.}
entries: You can knock aside ranged attacks. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, you knocked or cut it out of the air.

feat.name: Debilitating Shot
entries: Aiming for a weak point, you impede your foe with a precise shot. Make a ranged weapon {@action Strike|PC1}. If it hits and deals damage, the target is {@condition slowed||slowed 1} until the end of its next turn.

feat.name: Disarming Twist
feat.requirements: You are wielding a single one-handed melee weapon and hold nothing else in your hands.
entries: After your initial attack redirects your foe's defenses, your follow-up wrests their weapon from their grasp. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} with a one-handed melee weapon. In addition to its other effects, this {@action Strike|PC1} gains the success and critical success effects of the {@action Disarm|PC1} action. The {@action Strike|PC1} also has the following failure effect.

Failure: The target is {@condition off-guard|PC1} until the end of your current turn.

special: If you're in {@feat Disarming Stance|PC1}, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the attack roll.

feat.name: Disruptive Stance
entries: The slightest distraction can provoke your wrath, and you're prepared to foil enemies' actions. As long as you are in this stance, you can use {@action Reactive Strike|PC1} when a creature within your reach uses a {@trait concentrate} action, in addition to {@trait manipulate} and {@trait move} actions. Furthermore, you disrupt a triggering {@trait concentrate} or {@trait manipulate} action if your {@action Strike|PC1} hits (not only if it's a critical hit).

feat.name: Fearsome Brute
entries: Fear makes your foes weak and more vulnerable to your attacks. You gain a circumstance bonus to damage rolls for Strikes against {@condition frightened|PC1} creatures. The bonus is equal to double the target's {@condition frightened|PC1} value.
If you're a master in {@skill Intimidation|PC1}, increase the bonus to triple the target's {@condition frightened|PC1} value.

feat.name: Flinging Charge
entries: You throw a weapon to distract your opponent as you close the gap to begin your assault. You {@action Stride|PC1} twice; at any point during this movement, you can make a ranged {@action Strike|PC1} with a thrown weapon. If the {@action Strike|PC1} hits, the target is {@condition off-guard|PC1} against the next melee attack that you attempt against it before the end of your current turn.

feat.name: Mirror Shield
feat.trigger: An opponent casting a spell that targets you critically fails a spell attack roll against your AC.
feat.requirements: You have a shield raised.
entries: You reflect the spell back against its caster. Make a ranged attack against the attacker using your highest proficiency with a ranged weapon. If you can cast spells, you can choose to make a spell attack roll instead. If you succeed, your opponent takes the effects of a successful spell attack roll for their own spell (or the effects of a critical success if your attack roll was a critical success).

feat.name: Overpowering Charge
entries: You trample foes as you charge past. When you use {@feat Barreling Charge|PC1} and successfully move through a creature's space, that creature takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier. On a critical success, the creature takes double damage and is {@condition off-guard|PC1} until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Tactical Reflexes
entries: You are particularly swift at punishing foes who leave you openings. At the start of each of your turns when you regain your actions, you gain an additional reaction that can be used only to make a {@action Reactive Strike|PC1}.

feat.name: Twin Riposte
feat.trigger: A creature within your reach critically fails to {@action Strike|PC1} you.
feat.requirements: You are benefiting from {@feat Twin Parry (Fighter)|PC1}.
entries: A clever parry with one weapon leaves your opponent open to an attack with the other weapon. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} or {@action Disarm|PC1} action against the triggering opponent.

feat.name: Brutal Finish
feat.requirements: You are wielding a melee weapon in two hands.
entries: Your final blow can make an impact even if it rebounds off a foe's defenses. Make a {@action Strike|PC1} with a melee weapon you're wielding in two hands. After the {@action Strike|PC1}, your turn ends. The {@action Strike|PC1} deals one additional weapon damage die, or two additional weapon damage dice if you're at least 18th level. The {@action Strike|PC1} also gains the following failure effect.

Failure: You deal damage equal to one weapon damage die of the required weapon. Increase this to two dice if you're at least 18th level.

feat.name: Dashing Strike
feat.requirements: You are adjacent to an enemy.
entries: Springing away from one foe, you {@action Strike|PC1} at another. {@action Stride|PC1} up to your Speed, but you must end that movement within melee reach of a different enemy. At the end of your movement, make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} against an enemy now within reach. You can use Dashing {@action Strike|PC1} while Burrowing, Climbing, Flying, or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

feat.name: Dueling Dance
feat.requirements: You are wielding a single one-handed melee weapon and hold nothing else in your hands.
entries: Using a free hand as pivot and balance, you both attack and defend with your weapon. While you are in this stance, you constantly have the benefits of {@feat Dueling Parry|PC1}.

feat.name: Flinging Shove
entries: Whether you're shoving opponents with a shield or a large weapon, you've learned to push them even further. Increase the distance you {@action Shove|PC1} your opponent with {@feat Aggressive Block|PC1} or {@feat Brutish Shove|PC1} to 10 feet on a success or 20 feet on a critical success. When you use {@feat Aggressive Block|PC1}, you can choose whether the target is {@condition off-guard|PC1} or Shoved. When you make a {@feat Brutish Shove|PC1}, you also {@action Shove|PC1} the target 5 feet on a failure.

feat.name: Improved Dueling Riposte
entries: Your weapon whirls and darts, striking foes whenever the slightest opening or moment of weakness presents itself. You can use {@feat Dueling Riposte|PC1} even if you aren't benefiting from {@feat Dueling Parry|PC1}. At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to make a {@feat Dueling Riposte|PC1}.

feat.name: Incredible Ricochet
entries: After your first shot singles out your opponent's position, you direct another that ricochets around obstacles and strikes unerringly. Make a ranged weapon {@action Strike|PC1} against a creature you previously attacked this turn. You ignore the target's {@condition concealed|PC1} condition and all cover.

feat.name: Lunging Stance
feat.requirements: You are wielding a melee weapon.
entries: Your body coiled to strike, you can lash out at distant enemies. While you are in this stance, you can use {@action Reactive Strike|PC1} against a creature that is outside your reach but within the reach you would have with a {@feat Lunge|PC1}. If you do, you increase your range with the {@action Strike|PC1} by 5 feet.

feat.name: Paragon's Guard
feat.requirements: You are wielding a shield.
entries: Once you've had a moment to set your stance, you always have your shield ready without a thought. While you are in this stance, you constantly have your shield raised as if you'd used the {@action Raise a Shield|PC1} action.

feat.name: Desperate Finisher
feat.trigger: You complete the last action on your turn, and your turn has not ended yet.
entries: You throw everything you have into one last, reckless press. Use a single action that you know with the {@trait press} trait. You forgo the ability to use reactions until the start of your next turn. This press uses your multiple attack penalty, as normal.

feat.name: Determination
entries: Your training allows you to shrug off your foes' spells and conditions when the need is dire. Choose a single nonpermanent condition, spell, or {@trait magical} effect that is affecting you. If you chose a condition, its effect on you ends. If you chose a spell or other {@trait magical} effect, attempt to counteract the spell (your counteract rank is equal to half your level, rounded up, and you attempt a Will save as your counteract check).

This doesn't remove any Hit Point damage you already took from the spell or condition, and it removes the effect from only you, not from other creatures or the environment around you. It can't remove an ongoing affliction or prevent such an affliction from inflicting conditions on you later. It can't remove conditions occurring automatically due to your situation or positioning (such as {@condition prone|PC1} or flanked).

feat.name: Guiding Finish
feat.requirements: You are wielding a single one-handed melee weapon and hold nothing else in your hands.
entries: Using your weapon as a lever, you force your opponent to end up right where you want them. Make a {@action Strike|PC1} with a onehanded melee weapon. If the {@action Strike|PC1} hits, you can {@action Reposition|PC1} the target up to 10 feet. You can move the target through your space during this movement. Your {@action Strike|PC1} gains the following failure effect.

Failure: You can force the creature to move as you would on a success, but you can move the target only 5 feet.

feat.name: Guiding Riposte
entries: By shifting your weight and angling your weapon, you guide your opponent to a more favorable position. When you use {@feat Dueling Riposte|PC1} to {@action Strike|PC1} and you hit, you can {@action Reposition|PC1} up to 10 feet.

feat.name: Improved Twin Riposte
entries: Your weapons are a blur, blocking and biting at your foes. You can use {@feat Twin Riposte (Fighter)|PC1} even if you aren't benefiting from {@feat Twin Parry (Fighter)|PC1}. At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to make a {@feat Twin Riposte (Fighter)|PC1}.

feat.name: Opening Stance
feat.trigger: You roll initiative.
entries: At the first sign of trouble, often before you consciously realize the danger, you drop into a stance with a mere thought. Use an action that has the {@trait stance} trait.

feat.name: Two-Weapon Flurry
feat.requirements: You are wielding two weapons, each in a different hand.
entries: Using the momentum of your prior attack, you lash out with both your weapons in a sudden frenzy. {@action Strike|PC1} twice, once with each weapon.

feat.name: Whirlwind Strike
entries: You lash out in a blur of motion, attacking all nearby adversaries. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} against each enemy within your melee reach. Each attack counts toward your multiple attack penalty, but you do not increase your penalty until you have made all your attacks.

feat.name: Graceful Poise
entries: With the right positioning, your off-hand weapon can strike like a scorpion's stinger. While you are in this stance, if you make your second {@action Strike|PC1} from {@feat Double Slice|PC1} with an {@trait agile} weapon, {@feat Double Slice|PC1} counts as one attack when calculating your multiple attack penalty.

feat.name: Improved Reflexive Shield
entries: Your shield can help save nearby allies. When you use {@feat Shield Block|PC1} against damage resulting from a Reflex save, adjacent allies who would take damage due to Reflex saves against the same effect also benefit from the damage reduction.

feat.name: Master of Many Styles
feat.trigger: Your turn begins.
entries: You move fluidly between stances, using your mastery of combat to always adopt the best tactics. You use an action with the {@trait stance} trait.

feat.name: Multishot Stance
feat.requirements: You are wielding a ranged weapon with reload 0.
entries: You lock yourself in a stable position so you can fire swiftly and accurately. While you are in this stance, your penalty for {@feat Double Shot|PC1} is reduced to –1. If you move from your position, this stance ends.
special: If you have {@feat Triple Shot|PC1}, when you use {@feat Double Shot|PC1} to make three Strikes, the penalty is –2.

feat.name: Overwhelming Blow
entries: You throw your weight into a powerful attack that leaves you vulnerable. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1}. This counts as three attacks when calculating your multiple attack penalty. If this {@action Strike|PC1} hits, you get a critical hit. If you roll a critical hit, your weapon or unarmed attack also gains the {@trait deadly||deadly d12} trait (this replaces any {@trait deadly} trait it already has). Whether or not you hit, you become {@condition stunned||stunned 1} and are {@condition off-guard|PC1} until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Twinned Defense
feat.requirements: You are wielding two melee weapons, one in each hand.
entries: You're always ready to use your off-hand weapon to interfere with attacks against you. While you are in this stance, you constantly gain the benefits of the {@feat Twin Parry|PC1} action.

feat.name: Impossible Volley
feat.requirements: You are wielding a ranged weapon with the {@trait volley} trait and reload 0.
entries: You fire a volley at all foes in an area. Make one {@action Strike|PC1} with a –2 penalty against each enemy within a 10-foot-radius burst centered at or beyond your weapon's volley range. Roll the damage only once for all targets.
Each attack counts toward your multiple attack penalty, but do not increase your penalty until you have made all your attacks.

feat.name: Savage Critical
entries: The wounds you inflict are grievous. When you {@action Strike|PC1} with a weapon or unarmed attack for which you have legendary proficiency, you critically succeed if you roll a 19 on the die as long as that result would be a success. This has no effect on a 19 if the result would be a failure.

feat.name: Smash from the Air
entries: Your expertise enables you to knock away spells. You can use {@feat Cut From the Air|PC1} against ranged spell attacks.

feat.name: Boundless Reprisals
entries: With a sixth sense for the flow of combat, you can quickly react to any situation as required. At the start of each enemy's turn, you gain a reaction you can use only during that turn for any reaction from a fighter feat or class feature.

feat.name: Ultimate Flexibility
entries: Your experience keeps you on your toes, helping you adopt complex strategies on the fly and face the most dangerous challenges. When you gain a fighter feat using combat flexibility, you gain three fighter feats instead of two. While the first feat must still be 8th level or lower, the second feat can be up to 14th level, and the third feat can be up to 18th level.

You can use the first feat to meet the prerequisites of the second or third feats and the second feat to meet the prerequisites of the third feat. You must meet all three feats' other prerequisites normally.

In addition, you can adapt to the battlefield's challenges by spending 1 hour to train. If you do, you can reselect the feats chosen with combat flexibility as if you had made your daily preparations. You can't trade out limited-use abilities that you've already used, such as Determination.

feat.name: Weapon Supremacy
entries: Your skill with weapons bends the laws of reality, allowing you to continuously attack with speed that would normally require magical assistance. You're permanently {@condition quickened|PC1}. You can use your extra action only to {@action Strike|PC1}.

feat.name: Animal Companion
entries: You gain the service of a {@quickref young animal companion|PC1|0|young animal companions} that travels with you and obeys simple commands. See {@quickref Animal Companions|PC1|0|Animal Companions}. When you {@action Hunt Prey|PC1}, your animal companion gains the action's benefits and your hunter's edge benefit if you have one.

feat.name: Crossbow Ace
feat.requirements: You are wielding a crossbow with reload 1 or higher.
entries: Your deep understanding of the crossbow allows you to reload efficiently while moving yourself out of the line of return fire.
Either {@action Create a Diversion|PC1} or {@action Take Cover|PC1}, then {@action Interact|PC1} to reload.
As normal, you must meet the requirements to {@action Take Cover|PC1}; you must be {@condition prone|PC1}, benefiting from cover, or near a feature that allows you to {@action Take Cover|PC1}.

feat.name: Hunted Shot
feat.requirements: You are wielding a ranged weapon with reload 0.
entries: You take two quick shots against the one you hunt. Make two Strikes against your prey with the required weapon. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses. Apply your multiple attack penalty to each {@action Strike|PC1} normally.

feat.name: Initiate Warden
entries: You've trained with one of the ranger sects known as wardens, who practice a specialized type of primal magic. You gain your choice of one warden spell from the initial warden spells.
special: You can take this feat multiple times, choosing a different initial warden spell each time.

feat.name: Monster Hunter
entries: You quickly assess your prey and apply what you know. As part of the action used to Hunt your Prey, you can attempt a check to {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1} about your prey. When you critically succeed at identifying your hunted prey with {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1}, you note a weakness in the creature's defenses in addition to any other benefits. You and allies you tell gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your next attack roll against that prey.
You can give bonuses from Monster Hunter only once per day against a particular creature.

feat.name: Twin Takedown
feat.requirements: You are wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand.
entries: You swiftly attack your hunted prey with each of your weapons, potentially combining their damage into a single devastating attack. Make two Strikes against your hunted prey, one with each of the required weapons. If both hit the same hunted prey, combine their damage for the purpose of its resistances and weaknesses. Apply your multiple attack penalty to each {@action Strike|PC1} normally.

feat.name: Animal Empathy
entries: You have a connection to the creatures of the natural world that allows you to communicate with them on a rudimentary level. You can use {@skill Diplomacy|PC1} to {@action Make an Impression|PC1} on animals and to make very simple Requests of them. In most cases, wild animals will give you time to make your case.

feat.name: Favored Terrain
entries: You have studied a specific terrain to overcome its challenges. Choose aquatic, arctic, desert, forest, mountain, plains, sky, swamp, or underground as your favored terrain. When in that terrain, you can ignore the effects of non-magical difficult terrain. If you have the unimpeded journey class feature, you gain a second benefit while in your favored terrain, depending on your choice:

items: {@b Aquatic} You gain a swim Speed equal to your Speed. If you already had a swim Speed, you instead gain a +10- foot status bonus to your swim Speed.

{@b Arctic} You need to eat and drink only one-tenth as much as usual, you aren't affected by severe or extreme cold, and you can walk across ice and snow at full Speed without needing to {@action Balance|PC1}.

{@b Desert} You need to eat and drink only one-tenth as much as usual, you aren't affected by severe or extreme heat, and you can walk along sand at full Speed without needing to {@action Balance|PC1}.
{@b Forest}, Mountain, or Underground You gain a climb Speed equal to your Speed. If you already had a climb Speed, you instead gain a +10-foot status bonus to your climb Speed.
{@b Plains} You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your land Speed.
{@b Sky} You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your fly Speed, if you have one.
{@b Swamp} You can move across bogs at full Speed, even if they are deep enough to be greater difficult terrain or to normally require you to {@action Swim|PC1}.

feat.name: Hunter's Aim
entries: When you focus on aiming, your attack becomes particularly accurate. Make a ranged weapon {@action Strike|PC1} against your hunted prey. On this {@action Strike|PC1}, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll and ignore your prey's {@condition concealed|PC1} condition and any lesser cover.

feat.name: Monster Warden
entries: You understand how to defend yourself and others against your prey. When you grant bonuses from {@feat Monster Hunter|PC1}, you and your allies also each gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your next saving throw against that particular creature and to your AC against that creature's next attack against you.

feat.name: Quick Draw
entries: You draw your weapon and attack with the same motion. You {@action Interact|PC1} to draw a weapon, then {@action Strike|PC1} with that weapon.

feat.name: Advanced Warden
entries: You unlock more powerful primal spells. You gain your choice of one warden spell from the advanced warden spells.
special: You can take this feat multiple times, choosing a different advanced warden spell each time.

feat.name: Companion's Cry
entries: You can urge your companion to do its utmost. You can spend 2 actions to {@action Command an Animal|PC1} instead of 1 when commanding your animal companion. If you do, your animal companion uses an additional action.

feat.name: Disrupt Prey
feat.trigger: Your hunted prey is within your reach, and it uses a manipulate action, uses a move action, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.
entries: Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} against your prey. If the attack is a critical hit, you disrupt the triggering action.

feat.name: Far Shot
entries: Your experience in the field has taught you how to focus your aim at a distance, increasing your accuracy. Double your weapons' range increments.

feat.name: Favored Prey
entries: You have studied a specific type of wild creature and can hunt it more easily. When you gain this feat, choose animals, beasts, dragons, or both fungi and plants as your favored prey.
When you roll initiative and can see an enemy that belongs to the chosen category, you can {@action Hunt Prey|PC1} as a free action, designating that enemy.

You can use this free action even if you haven't identified the creature yet with {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1}. The benefit doesn't apply against favored enemies disguised as other creatures, and the GM determines whether it applies against a creature disguised as a favored prey.

feat.name: Running Reload
entries: You can reload your weapon on the move. You {@action Stride|PC1}, {@action Step|PC1}, or {@action Sneak|PC1}, then {@action Interact|PC1} to reload.

feat.name: Scout's Warning
feat.trigger: You are about to roll a {@skill Perception|PC1} or {@skill Survival|PC1} check for initiative.
entries: You visually or audibly warn your allies of danger, granting them each a +1 circumstance bonus to their initiative rolls.
Depending on whether you use gestures or call out, this action gains either the {@trait visual} or the {@trait auditory} trait, respectively.

feat.name: Twin Parry
feat.requirements: You are wielding two melee weapons, one in each hand.
entries: You can use two weapons to deflect attacks. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, or a +2 circumstance bonus if either weapon has the {@trait parry} trait.
You lose this circumstance bonus if you no longer meet this feat's requirement.

feat.name: Additional Recollection
feat.trigger: You succeed or critically succeed at a check to {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1} on your hunted prey.
entries: You scan the battlefield quickly, remembering critical details about multiple opponents you face. You immediately attempt a check to {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1} about a different creature you can perceive.

feat.name: Masterful Warden
entries: Your mastery of warden magic increases. You gain your choice of one warden spell from the master warden spells.
special: You can take this feat multiple times, choosing a different master warden spell each time.

feat.name: Mature Animal Companion
entries: Your animal companion becomes a {@quickref mature animal companion|PC1|0|Mature Animal Companions} and gains additional capabilities. Your animal companion has greater independence. During an encounter, even if you don't use the {@action Command an Animal|PC1} action, your animal companion can still use 1 action that round on your turn to {@action Stride|PC1} or {@action Strike|PC1}. It can do this at any point during your turn, as long as you aren't currently taking an action. If it does, that's all the actions it gets that round—you can't Command it later.

feat.name: Skirmish Strike
entries: Your feet and weapon move in tandem. Either {@action Step|PC1} and then {@action Strike|PC1}, or {@action Strike|PC1} and then {@action Step|PC1}.

feat.name: Snap Shot
entries: You can react with ranged weapons when a creature is in close quarters. You can use a reaction that normally allows you to make a melee weapon {@action Strike|PC1} to instead make a ranged weapon {@action Strike|PC1}. You must be Striking an adjacent target. If necessary for the reaction's trigger, you treat your ranged weapon as if it had a reach of 5 feet. If the reaction has other requirements, such as wielding a specific kind of weapon, Snap Shot doesn't allow you to ignore them; it allows you only to replace a melee weapon {@action Strike|PC1} with a ranged weapon {@action Strike|PC1}.

feat.name: Swift Tracker
entries: Your keen eyes catch signs of passage even when you're moving. You can move at your full Speed while you {@action Track|PC1}.

If you have master proficiency in {@skill Survival|PC1}, you don't need to attempt a new {@skill Survival|PC1} check every hour while Tracking. If you have legendary proficiency in {@skill Survival|PC1}, you can use another exploration activity while Tracking.

If you roll {@skill Survival|PC1} for initiative while tracking your hunted prey, when you start your first turn of the encounter, you can {@action Stride|PC1} toward your hunted prey as a free action.

feat.name: Blind-Fight
entries: Your heightened senses allow you to instinctively detect unseen opponents. You don't need to succeed at a flat check to target {@condition concealed|PC1} creatures. You're not {@condition off-guard|PC1} to creatures that are hidden from you (unless you're {@condition off-guard|PC1} to them for reasons other than the {@condition hidden|PC1} condition), and you need only a successful DC {@flatDC 5} flat check to target a {@condition hidden|PC1} creature.
While you're adjacent to an {@condition undetected|PC1} creature of your level or lower, it is instead only {@condition hidden|PC1} from you.

feat.name: Deadly Aim
entries: You aim for your prey's weak spots, making your shot more challenging but dealing more damage if you hit. Make a ranged {@action Strike|PC1} against your hunted prey at a –2 penalty. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to damage on that {@action Strike|PC1}. This bonus increases to +6 at 11th level and +8 at 15th level.

feat.name: Hazard Finder
entries: You have an intuitive ability to sense hazards. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to {@skill Perception|PC1} checks to find traps and hazards, to AC against their attacks, and to saves against their effects. You can find hazards that would normally require you to {@action Search|PC1} even if you aren't Searching.

feat.name: Terrain Master
entries: You are able to adapt to your surroundings in any natural terrain. You can spend 1 hour practicing in your current terrain in order to make it your favored terrain, replacing your current favored terrain temporarily. If you spend a full day out of the new favored terrain, your favored terrain reverts back to your original choice when you took the {@feat Favored Terrain|PC1} feat.

feat.name: Warden's Boon
entries: You point out vulnerabilities present in your hunted prey, granting the benefits listed in {@action Hunt Prey|PC1} and your hunter's edge to an ally until the end of their next turn. Depending on whether you call out or use gestures, this action gains either the {@trait auditory} or {@trait visual} trait.

feat.name: Camouflage
entries: You alter your appearance to blend in to the wilderness. In natural terrain, you can {@action Hide|PC1} and {@action Sneak|PC1} even without cover or being {@condition concealed|PC1}.

feat.name: Incredible Companion
entries: Your animal companion continues to grow and develop. It becomes a {@companionAbility nimble|PC1} or {@companionAbility savage|PC1} animal companion (your choice), gaining additional capabilities determined by the type of companion.

feat.name: Master Monster Hunter
entries: You have a nearly encyclopedic knowledge of all creatures of the world. You can use {@skill Nature|PC1} to {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1} to identify any creature. In addition, you gain the benefits of {@feat Monster Hunter|PC1} (and {@feat Monster Warden|PC1}, if you have it) on a success as well as a critical success.

feat.name: Peerless Warden
entries: Your mastery of primal magic has given you access to the greatest secrets of warden magic. You gain your choice of one warden spell from the peerless warden spells.
special: You can take this feat multiple times, choosing a different peerless warden spell each time.

feat.name: Penetrating Shot
feat.requirements: You are wielding a ranged weapon.
entries: You shoot clear through an intervening creature to hit your prey. Choose a target that is giving lesser cover to your hunted prey. Make a single ranged {@action Strike|PC1} with the required weapon against the chosen target and your hunted prey. This attack ignores any lesser cover the chosen target provides your hunted prey. Roll damage only once, and apply it to each creature you hit. A Penetrating Shot counts as two attacks for your multiple attack penalty.

feat.name: Twin Riposte
feat.trigger: A creature within your reach critically fails a {@action Strike|PC1} against you.
feat.requirements: You are benefiting from {@feat Twin Parry (Ranger)|PC1}
entries: A clever parry with one weapon leaves your opponent open to an attack with the other weapon. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} or use a {@action Disarm|PC1} action against the triggering opponent

feat.name: Warden's Step
entries: You can guide your allies to move quietly through the wilderness. When you {@action Avoid Notice|PC1} during exploration in natural terrain, you can designate any number of your allies to gain the benefits as if they were using that activity during that exploration. This requires no action on their part.

feat.name: Distracting Shot
entries: The sheer power of your attacks, or the overwhelming number of them, leaves an enemy flustered. If you critically hit your hunted prey with a ranged weapon, or hit it at least twice on the same turn with a ranged weapon, it's {@condition off-guard|PC1} until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Double Prey
entries: You can focus on two foes at once, hunting both of them down. When you use the {@action Hunt Prey|PC1} action, you can pick two creatures as your prey.

feat.name: Second Sting
feat.requirements: You are wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand.
entries: You read your prey's movements and transform them into openings, so failures with one weapon set up glancing blows with the other. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} with one of the required weapons against your hunted prey. The {@action Strike|PC1} gains the following failure effect.

Failure: You deal the damage the other required weapon would have dealt on a hit, excluding all damage dice.
(This removes dice from weapon runes, spells, and special abilities, not just weapon damage dice.)

feat.name: Side by Side
entries: You and your animal companion fight in tandem. Whenever you and your animal companion are adjacent to the same foe, you are both flanking that foe with each other, regardless of your actual positions.

feat.name: Warden's Focus
entries: Your connection with your surroundings deepens and expands, allowing you to draw in more of nature's primal power as you focus. When you {@action Refocus|PC1}, you regain all your Focus Points instead of 1.

feat.name: Sense the Unseen
feat.trigger: You fail a check to {@action Seek|PC1}.
entries: When you look for foes, you can catch even the slightest cues, such as their minute movements or the shifting of air currents on your skin. Even though you failed at the triggering check, you automatically sense any {@condition undetected|PC1} creatures in the area where you're Seeking, making them merely {@condition hidden|PC1} to you.

feat.name: Shared Prey
entries: Hunting as a duo, you and your ally both single out your prey. When you use {@action Hunt Prey|PC1} and select only one prey, you can grant your {@action Hunt Prey|PC1} benefits and hunter's edge to an ally in addition to gaining them yourself. The ally retains these benefits until you use {@action Hunt Prey|PC1} again.

feat.name: Stealthy Companion
entries: You've trained your animal companion to blend in to its surroundings. Your animal companion gains the benefit of the {@feat Camouflage|PC1} feat. If your companion is a specialized ambusher, its proficiency rank for {@skill Stealth|PC1} increases to master (or legendary if it was already master).

feat.name: Warden's Guidance
entries: You convey your prey's location to your allies with a series of careful words or gestures. As long as your hunted prey is {@condition observed|PC1} by you, all your allies who roll failures and critical failures when Seeking it get a success instead. Your allies need to be able to see or hear you to gain this benefit. You have to be able to call out or make visible gestures for your allies to get this benefit.

feat.name: Greater Distracting Shot
entries: Even a single missile can throw off your enemy's balance, and more powerful attacks leave it flustered for longer. If you hit your hunted prey with a ranged weapon, it's {@condition off-guard|PC1} until the start of your next turn. If you critically hit your prey or hit it twice on the same turn with a ranged weapon, it's {@condition off-guard|PC1} until the end of your next turn instead.

feat.name: Improved Twin Riposte
entries: At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to perform a {@feat Twin Riposte (Ranger)|PC1}. You can use this extra reaction even if you are not benefiting from {@feat Twin Parry (Ranger)|PC1}.

feat.name: Legendary Monster Hunter
feat.prerequisites: legendary in {@skill Nature|PC1}, {@feat Master Monster Hunter|PC1}
entries: Your knowledge of monsters is so incredible that it reveals glaring flaws in your prey. Your bonus from {@feat Monster Hunter|PC1} (and the bonus from {@feat Monster Warden|PC1} if you have it) increases from +1 to +2 for you and any allies who benefit.

feat.name: Specialized Companion
entries: Your animal companion continues to grow in power and ability, and it is now cunning enough to become specialized. Your animal companion gains one specialization of your choice.
special: You can select this feat up to three times. Each time, add a different specialization to your companion.

feat.name: Warden's Reload
feat.requirements: Your last action or activity this turn was to cast a warden spell.
entries: Your mastery of magic and weapons like the crossbow allow you to wield both with equal ease. {@action Interact|PC1} to reload a weapon you are currently wielding.

feat.name: Impossible Flurry
feat.requirements: You are wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand.
entries: You forgo precision to attack at an impossible speed. Make three melee Strikes with each of the required weapons. Your first attack with each weapon takes the multiple attack penalty as though you had already made one attack this turn. All of the remaining Strikes take the maximum multiple attack penalty.

feat.name: Impossible Volley
feat.requirements: You are wielding a ranged weapon with the {@trait volley} trait and reload 0.
entries: You fire a volley at all foes in an area. Make one {@action Strike|PC1} with a –2 penalty against each enemy within a 10-foot burst centered at or beyond your weapon's volley range. Roll the damage only once for all targets.
Each attack counts toward your multiple attack penalty, but do not increase your penalty until you have made all your attacks.

feat.name: Manifold Edge
entries: You've learned to leverage every possible edge. When you use {@action Hunt Prey|PC1}, you can gain a different hunter's edge benefit instead of the one you selected at 1st level. If you do, you don't gain the additional benefit from masterful hunter.

feat.name: Masterful Companion
entries: Your animal companion shares your incredible hunting skills, allowing it to take down your shared prey with ease. When you {@action Hunt Prey|PC1}, your animal companion gains the masterful hunter benefit associated with your hunter's edge, rather than just your original hunter's edge benefit.

feat.name: Perfect Shot
feat.requirements: You are wielding a loaded ranged weapon with reload 1 or more, and you have not reloaded your weapon since your last turn.
entries: After watching the motions of combat with incredible intensity and precision, you fire at your prey at the perfect moment to deliver maximum pain. Make a ranged {@action Strike|PC1} with the required weapon against your hunted prey. If you hit, the {@action Strike|PC1} deals maximum damage. After the {@action Strike|PC1}, your turn ends.

feat.name: Shadow Hunter
entries: You blend in to your surroundings so well that others have trouble telling you apart from the terrain. While in natural terrain, you're always {@condition concealed|PC1} from all foes if you choose to be, except for your hunted prey.

feat.name: Legendary Shot
entries: You focus on your hunted prey, perceiving angles, air resistance, and every variable that would affect your ranged attack. If you have master proficiency with your ranged weapon, you can ignore the penalty for attacking up to five range increments away when attacking your hunted prey.

feat.name: To the Ends of the Earth
entries: Your ability to track your prey has surpassed explanation, allowing you to trace your prey's movements and predict its location with ease. When you use {@action Hunt Prey|PC1} on a creature within 100 feet, you can follow that creature's movements, allowing you to know the creature's exact location no matter how far away it becomes, as long as it remains your prey. You must be legendary in {@skill Nature|PC1} to track your prey's location across teleportation or planar travel. This feat gains the {@trait detection} and {@trait primal} traits if you're legendary in {@skill Nature|PC1}.

feat.name: Triple Threat
entries: You can divide your attention three ways when hunting. When you use {@action Hunt Prey|PC1}, you can designate three creatures as prey, designate two creatures as prey and share the effect with one ally (as {@feat Shared Prey|PC1}), or designate one creature as prey and share the effect with two allies.

feat.name: Ultimate Skirmisher
entries: You are so skilled at navigating the wild, your movement is completely unaffected by terrain. You ignore the effects of all difficult terrain, greater difficult terrain, and hazardous terrain, and you don't trigger traps and hazards that are triggered by moving into an area (such as trip wires and pressure plates), unless you want to.

feat.name: Nimble Dodge
feat.trigger: A creature targets you with an attack and you can see the attacker.
feat.requirements: You are not {@condition encumbered|PC1}.
entries: You deftly dodge out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

feat.name: Overextending Feint
entries: You goad a foe into overextending. On a successful {@action Feint|PC1}, you can use the following success and critical success effects instead of any other effects that would occur when you {@action Feint|PC1}.

Critical Success: The target takes a –2 circumstance penalty to all attack rolls against you before the end of its next turn.
Success: The target takes a –2 circumstance penalty to its next attack roll against you before the end of its next turn.

feat.name: Plant Evidence
entries: You can put a single item you're holding of light or negligible Bulk onto a person without them noticing by succeeding at a {@skill Thievery|PC1} check against their {@skill Perception|PC1} DC. If you have the ruffian racket, you can do this as a free action when you successfully {@action Shove|PC1} a target.

feat.name: Trap Finder
entries: You have an intuitive sense that alerts you to the presence of traps. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to {@skill Perception|PC1} checks to find traps, to AC against attacks made by traps, and to saves against traps. Even if you aren't {@action Search|PC1|Searching}, you get a check to find traps that normally require you to be {@action Search|PC1|Searching}. You still need to meet any other requirements to find the trap.

You can disable traps that require a proficiency rank of master in {@skill Thievery|PC1}. If you have master proficiency in {@skill Thievery|PC1}, you can disable traps that require a proficiency rank of legendary instead, and your circumstance bonuses against traps increase to +2.

feat.name: Tumble Behind
entries: You tumble under and behind your foe, your rapid movement letting you catch them off guard. When you successfully {@action Tumble Through|PC1}, the foe whose space you passed through is {@condition off-guard|PC1} against the next attack you make before the end of your turn.

feat.name: Twin Feint
feat.requirements: You are wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand.
entries: You use an attack with one weapon to distract your foe from a second attack coming at a different angle. Make one Strike with each of your two melee weapons, both against the same target. The target is automatically {@condition off-guard|PC1} against the second attack. Apply your multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.}

feat.name: You're Next
feat.trigger: You reduce an enemy to 0 Hit Points.
entries: After downing a foe, you menace another. Attempt to {@action Demoralize|PC1} a creature within 60 feet, with a +2 circumstance bonus. If you have legendary proficiency in {@skill Intimidation|PC1}, you can use this as a free action with the same trigger.

feat.name: Brutal Beating
entries: Your critical hits shakes your foes' confidence. Whenever your {@action Strike|PC1} is a critical hit and deals damage, the target is {@condition frightened||frightened 1}.

feat.name: Clever Gambit
feat.trigger: Your {@action Strike|PC1} critically hits and deals damage to a creature you've identified with {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1}.
entries: Your battle tactics are aided by assessing your foe's capabilities and range. You {@action Step|PC1} or {@action Stride|PC1}; this movement doesn't trigger reactions from the triggering creature.

feat.name: Distracting Feint
entries: Your Feints are far more distracting than normal. While a creature is {@condition off-guard|PC1} by your {@action Feint|PC1}, it also takes a –2 circumstance penalty to {@skill Perception|PC1} checks and Reflex saves.

feat.name: Mobility
entries: You move without leaving an opening. When you {@action Stride|PC1} and move half your Speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions.
You can use Mobility when Climbing, Flying, or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

feat.name: Quick Draw
entries: You draw your weapon and attack with the same motion. You {@action Interact|PC1} to draw a weapon, then {@action Strike|PC1} with that weapon.

feat.name: Strong Arm
entries: When you {@action Strike|PC1} with a thrown weapon, the weapon's range increment increases by 10 feet.

feat.name: Unbalancing Blow
entries: Interweaving attacks, you unbalance your foes. Whenever your Strike is a critical hit and deals damage, the target is {@condition off-guard|PC1} against your attacks until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Underhanded Assault
entries: You capitalize on the distraction provided by an ally. You {@action Sneak|PC1} up to a foe adjacent to one of your allies. You can roll against the foe you're Sneaking up on, even if it's currently observing you, as though you were {@condition hidden|PC1}. You take a –2 penalty on your {@skill Stealth|PC1} check. If your {@skill Stealth|PC1} check against the chosen foe succeeds, you can make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} against that foe at the end of your {@action Sneak|PC1}.

feat.name: Dread Striker
entries: You capitalize on your enemies' fear to slip past their defenses.
Any creature that has the frightened condition is also {@condition off-guard|PC1} against your attacks.

feat.name: Head Stomp
entries: Make an unarmed melee {@action Strike|PC1} against a {@condition prone|PC1} target. If it hits, until the end of your next turn the target is {@condition stupefied||stupefied 1} (or {@condition stupefied||stupefied 2} on a critical hit) and {@condition off-guard|PC1}.

feat.name: Mug
entries: You make a quick attack and rob your foe in the process. Make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} against an adjacent enemy. If you hit and deal sneak attack damage, you can also attempt to {@action Steal|PC1} from the target, even if the target is in combat.

feat.name: Poison Weapon
feat.requirements: You are wielding a weapon.
entries: You apply a contact poison or injury poison to the required weapon; if you have a free hand, you can {@action Interact|PC1} to draw a poison as part of this action. This poison can be one of the simple injury poisons you can create due to this feat (see Special), or another contact or injury poison you've acquired.
special: During your daily preparations, you can prepare a number of simple injury poisons equal to your rogue level.

These follow the rules for injury poisons, except that they deal {@damage 1d4} poison damage with no saving throw. Only you can apply these poisons properly, and they expire the next time you prepare.

feat.name: Predictable!
entries: By observing an opponent, you can get a sense of their next move and prepare to counter or resist it. Choose one target and attempt a {@skill Perception|PC1} check to {@action Sense Motive|PC1} against the foe's {@skill Deception|PC1} DC or a hard DC of the foe's level, whichever is higher.

Critical Success: You precisely discern the target's strategy, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the creature until the start of your next turn and a +2 circumstance bonus to your next saving throw against the creature before the start of your next turn.
Success: You deduce the gist of the target's strategy; as critical success, except the circumstance bonus is only +1.
Failure: You fail to discern the target's strategy and gain no benefit.
Critical Failure: You misinterpret the target's strategy and take a –1 circumstance penalty to AC against the creature until the start of your next turn, and a –1 circumstance penalty to your next saving throw against the creature before the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Reactive Pursuit
feat.trigger: An adjacent foe moves away from you, and you can reach at least one space adjacent to the foe with a {@action Stride|PC1} action.
entries: You keep pace with a retreating foe. You {@action Stride|PC1}, but you must end your movement adjacent to the triggering enemy. Your move does not trigger reactions from the triggering enemy. You can use Reactive Pursuit to {@action Burrow|PC1}, {@action Climb|PC1}, {@action Fly|PC1}, or {@action Swim|PC1} instead of {@action Stride|PC1} if you have the corresponding movement type.

feat.name: Sabotage
feat.requirements: You have a free hand.
entries: You subtly damage others' equipment. Choose one item that a creature within your reach wields or carries. The item must have moving parts that you could possibly sabotage (a shortbow could be sabotaged, but a longsword could not). Attempt a {@skill Thievery|PC1} check against the Reflex DC of the creature. Damage dealt by Sabotage can't take the item below its {@condition Broken|PC1} Threshold.

Critical Success: You deal damage equal to 4 x your {@skill Thievery|PC1} proficiency bonus.
Success: You deal damage equal to double your {@skill Thievery|PC1} proficiency bonus.
Critical Failure: The item is temporarily immune to your Sabotage for 1 day.

feat.name: Scoundrel's Surprise
entries: You drop your disguise at the right moment and surprise your target. After you {@action Impersonate|PC1} someone else using a disguise kit, you can remove your disguise with a dramatic gesture. Any creatures that previously failed to see through your disguise are {@condition off-guard|PC1} against the next attack you make before the end of your turn.

feat.name: Scout's Warning
feat.trigger: You are about to roll a {@skill Perception|PC1} or {@skill Survival|PC1} check for initiative.
entries: You visually or audibly warn your allies of danger, granting them each a +1 circumstance bonus to their initiative rolls. Depending on whether you use gestures or call out, this action gains either the {@trait visual} or {@trait auditory} trait, respectively.

feat.name: The Harder They Fall
entries: You make your foes fall painfully when you trip them. When you successfully {@action Trip|PC1} an {@condition off-guard|PC1} foe, your target takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage. On a critical success, the target takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage plus your sneak attack damage.

feat.name: Twin Distraction
feat.requirements: You are wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand.
entries: Your movements with two weapons are so swift and disorienting that they befuddle your opponent. When using Twin {@action Feint|PC1}, if both your Strikes deal damage to a targeted creature, the target must succeed at a Will saving throw against your class DC or become {@condition stupefied||stupefied 1} until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Analyze Weakness
feat.requirements: You have identified a creature with {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1}.
entries: Your knowledge of a creature's physiology helps you attack with pinpoint accuracy. You carefully study a creature that you've identified to scope out particularly weak points in its positioning or physical form. The next time you deal sneak attack damage to the chosen creature with a {@action Strike|PC1} before the end of your turn, add an additional {@damage 2d6} precision damage.
At 11th level, the additional damage becomes {@dice 3d6}, and at 17th level it becomes {@dice 4d6}.

feat.name: Anticipate Ambush
entries: You keep watch for any {@condition hidden|PC1} creatures or dangerous sites, moving at half your travel Speed. If you're Anticipating an Ambush at the start of an encounter, you roll a {@skill Perception|PC1} check for initiative, and all enemies rolling {@skill Stealth|PC1} for initiative take a –2 circumstance penalty to their {@skill Stealth|PC1} checks.

feat.name: Far Throw
entries: When you {@action Strike|PC1} with a thrown weapon, you take only a –1 penalty for each additional range increment between you and the target, rather than a –2 penalty.

feat.name: Gang Up
entries: You and your allies harry an opponent in concert. You can flank an enemy if it's within reach of both of you and an ally—you and your ally don't have to be on opposite sides. This benefits your allies as well as you, but only if they're flanking with you, not each other.
The other requirements for flanking must still be met.

feat.name: Light Step
entries: You aren't bothered by tricky footing. When you {@action Stride|PC1} or {@action Step|PC1}, you can ignore difficult terrain.

feat.name: Shove Down
feat.requirements: Your last action was a successful {@action Shove|PC1}.
entries: You leverage your weight to topple foes that you move. You attempt to {@action Trip|PC1} the target, even if the target is no longer in your reach.

feat.name: Skirmish Strike
entries: Your feet and weapon move in tandem. Either {@action Step|PC1} and then {@action Strike|PC1}, or {@action Strike|PC1} and then {@action Step|PC1}.

feat.name: Sly Disarm
entries: You can {@action Disarm|PC1} a creature through sleight of hand rather than brute force. You can use {@skill Thievery|PC1} instead of {@skill Athletics|PC1} when you attempt a {@action Disarm|PC1}. When you use {@skill Thievery|PC1} to attempt a {@action Disarm|PC1} and succeed, the target is {@condition off-guard|PC1} against the next attack you make before the end of your turn.

feat.name: Twist the Knife
feat.requirements: Your last action was a melee {@action Strike|PC1} that dealt sneak attack damage to an {@condition off-guard|PC1} target.
entries: After stabbing your opponent in a weak spot, you tear the wound open. You deal {@condition persistent damage|PC1|persistent bleed damage} to the target equal to your number of sneak attack damage dice.

feat.name: Watch Your Back
entries: You menace the target, stoking their fears and drawing their attention. Attempt an {@skill Intimidation|PC1} check against the Will DC of a target within 30 feet. If you succeed, for 1 minute, that target gains a +2 status bonus to {@skill Perception|PC1} checks against you, but it takes a –2 status penalty to Will saves against {@trait fear} effects.

feat.name: Blind-Fight
entries: Your battle instincts make you more aware of {@condition concealed|PC1} and {@condition invisible|PC1} opponents. You don't need to succeed at a flat check to target {@condition concealed|PC1} creatures. You're not {@condition off-guard|PC1} to creatures that are {@condition hidden|PC1} from you (unless you're {@condition off-guard|PC1} to them for reasons other than the {@condition hidden|PC1} condition), and you need only a successful DC {@flatDC 5} flat check to target a {@condition hidden|PC1} creature.
While you're adjacent to an {@condition undetected|PC1} creature of your level or lower, it is instead only {@condition hidden|PC1} from you.

feat.name: Bullseye
entries: You carefully take aim to avoid your foe's concealment and cover. On your next {@action Strike|PC1} with a thrown weapon before the end of your turn, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your attack roll and ignore your target's {@condition concealed|PC1} condition, as well as the target's lesser cover or standard cover; if the target had greater cover, they instead have only standard cover against the {@action Strike|PC1}.

feat.name: Delay Trap
feat.trigger: A trap within your reach is triggered.
entries: You try to jam the workings of a trap to delay its effects. Attempt a {@skill Thievery|PC1} check to {@action Disable a Device|PC1} on the trap with the following results instead of the normal ones for the action.

Critical Success: You either prevent the trap from being triggered or delay the activation until the start or end of your next turn.
Success: As above, but the GM chooses whichever is worse for you.
Critical Failure: {@condition off-guard|PC1|You're off-guard until the start of your next turn.}

feat.name: Improved Poison Weapon
entries: You deliver poisons in ways that maximize their harmful effects.

When you apply a simple poison with {@feat Poison Weapon|PC1}, the poison deals {@damage 2d4} poison damage instead of {@damage 1d4} poison damage. You don't waste a poison you apply with {@feat Poison Weapon|PC1} on a critically failed attack roll.

feat.name: Inspired Stratagem
