entries: During your daily preparations, you can review stratagems for the day's adventures with up to five allies. Later, you can quickly advise them on your schemes using the below reaction.

entries.name: Inspired Stratagem
entries.trigger: An ally you reviewed stratagems with is about to attempt an attack roll or skill check
entries: The ally rolls the triggering check twice and takes the better of the two results. That ally then becomes temporarily immune to your Inspired Stratagem until your next daily preparations.

feat.name: Nimble Roll
entries: You throw yourself into a roll to escape imminent danger. You can use {@feat Nimble Dodge|PC1} before attempting a Reflex save in addition to its original trigger. If you do, the circumstance bonus applies to your Reflex save against the triggering effect.

When you use {@feat Nimble Dodge|PC1} and the triggering attack fails or critically fails, or when you succeed or critically succeed at the saving throw, you can also {@action Stride|PC1} up to 10 feet as part of the reaction. If you do, the reaction gains the {@trait move} trait. You can use Nimble Roll while Flying or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

feat.name: Opportune Backstab
feat.trigger: A creature within your melee reach is hit by a melee attack from one of your allies.
entries: When your enemy is hit by your ally, you capitalize upon the distraction. Make a {@action Strike|PC1} against the triggering creature.

feat.name: Predictive Purchase
entries: You somehow manage to have just the thing for the situation. You gain the {@feat Prescient Planner|PC1} and {@feat Prescient Consumable|PC1} feats. When using Prescient Planner, you can draw the item from your backpack (or a similar container) as a 2-action activity, instead of taking 1 minute to do so.

feat.name: Ricochet Stance
entries: You adopt a stance to rebound your thrown weapons toward you. While you are in this stance, any thrown weapons you use as part of a ranged {@action Strike|PC1} to deal bludgeoning or slashing damage immediately return to your hand, enabling you to use them for additional Strikes. You must be within the weapon's listed range increment and have a hand free to catch the weapon. If you make a ranged {@action Strike|PC1} with a thrown weapon outside of its listed range increment, it instead flies back toward you a number of feet equal to its listed range increment and then falls to the ground.

feat.name: Sidestep
feat.trigger: The attack roll for a {@action Strike|PC1} targeting you fails or critically fails.
entries: You deftly step out of the way of an attack, letting the blow continue. You redirect the attack to a creature of your choice that is adjacent to you and within the reach of the triggering attack.
The attacker rerolls the {@action Strike|PC1}'s attack roll against the new target.

feat.name: Sly Striker
entries: Your attacks deal more damage, even against creatures that aren't {@condition off-guard|PC1}. When you succeed or critically succeed at a {@action Strike|PC1} against a creature that isn't {@condition off-guard|PC1}, you also deal {@damage 1d6} precision damage. This applies only if you're using a weapon or unarmed attack you could deal sneak attack damage with. At 14th level, if you would normally deal {@dice 3d6} or more sneak attack damage to {@condition off-guard|PC1} creatures, you deal {@damage 2d6} precision damage to creatures that aren't {@condition off-guard|PC1}.

feat.name: Swipe Souvenir
feat.requirements: You're {@condition grabbed|PC1} or {@condition restrained|PC1} by a creature.
entries: When you wriggle free from an enemy's grasp, you take something of theirs with you. You attempt to {@action Escape|PC1} from being {@condition grabbed|PC1} or {@condition restrained|PC1} by a creature. If you succeed, you can also attempt to {@action Steal|PC1} from the creature, even if the creature is in combat.

feat.name: Tactical Entry
feat.requirements: You rolled {@skill Stealth|PC1} for initiative in this encounter, and neither you nor any enemies have acted yet.
entries: You {@action Stride|PC1}. This movement doesn't trigger any reactions.

feat.name: Methodical Debilitations
entries: You strategically craft your debilitations to lessen or negate an enemy's tactical advantages. Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use {@action Debilitating Strike|PC1}.

items: {@b Debilitation} The target can't flank or contribute to allies' flanking.

{@b Debilitation} The target doesn't gain a circumstance bonus to AC from {@action Raise a Shield||Raising a Shield}, lesser cover, or standard cover; it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC only from greater cover or {@action Take Cover||Taking Cover}.

feat.name: Nimble Strike
entries: You're cunning enough to find an opening in an opponent's attack.

When you use your {@feat Nimble Dodge|PC1} reaction, you can make a melee {@action Strike|PC1} against the triggering creature. This {@action Strike|PC1} doesn't count toward your multiple attack penalty, and your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike|PC1}. If you use the {@feat Nimble Roll|PC1} feat, you can make this {@action Strike|PC1} at any point during your roll.

feat.name: Precise Debilitations
entries: You attack with great precision. Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use {@action Debilitating Strike|PC1}.

items: {@b Debilitation} The target takes an additional {@damage 2d6} precision damage from your attacks.
{@b Debilitation} The target becomes {@condition off-guard|PC1}.

feat.name: Sneak Adept
entries: It's almost impossible to spot you. When you roll a failure on a {@action Sneak|PC1} action, you get a success instead. You can still critically fail.

feat.name: Tactical Debilitations
entries: You learn new debilitations that grant you tactical advantages against your foes. Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use {@action Debilitating Strike|PC1}.

items: {@b Debilitation} The target can't use reactions.
{@b Debilitation} The target can't flank or contribute to allies' flanking.

feat.name: Vicious Debilitations
entries: The debilitations you dish out seriously impair your foes. Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use {@action Debilitating Strike|PC1}.

items: {@b Debilitation} The target gains weakness 5 to your choice of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage.
{@b Debilitation} The target becomes {@condition clumsy||clumsy 1}.

feat.name: Bloody Debilitation
entries: Your attacks slice arteries and veins. Add the following debilitation to the list you can choose from when you use {@action Debilitating Strike|PC1}.

items: {@b Debilitation} The target takes {@damage 3d6} {@condition persistent damage|PC1|persistent bleed damage}.

feat.name: Critical Debilitation
entries: Your debilitations are especially effective on your most powerful attacks. Whenever you critically succeed at an attack roll against an enemy and use {@action Debilitating Strike|PC1}, add the following debilitation to the list you can choose from.

items: {@b Debilitation} The target attempts a Fortitude save against your class DC with the following effects.

Success: The target is {@condition slowed||slowed 1} until the end of your next turn.
Failure: The target is {@condition slowed||slowed 2} until the end of your next turn.
Critical Failure: The target is {@condition paralyzed|PC1} until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Fantastic Leap
entries: You launch yourself through the air at a foe. Attempt a {@action High Jump|PC1} or {@action Long Jump|PC1}. If you attempt a {@action High Jump|PC1}, determine the height of your jump as though determining the length of a {@action Long Jump|PC1}. At the end of your jump, you can make a melee {@action Strike|PC1}.
After your {@action Strike|PC1}, you fall to the ground if you're in the air. If the distance of your fall is no more than the height of your jump, you take no damage and land upright.

feat.name: Felling Shot
entries: Your ranged attacks can shoot an unprepared foe right out of the air. Make a ranged {@action Strike|PC1} against an {@condition off-guard|PC1} creature.
If the {@action Strike|PC1} is a success and deals damage, the target must attempt a Reflex save against your class DC.

Failure: The target falls up to 120 feet. If it hits the ground, it takes no damage from the fall.
Critical Failure: As failure, and the target can't fly, jump, levitate, or otherwise leave the ground until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Preparation
entries: You survey the battlefield, calculating the possibilities. You gain one additional reaction, which you can use before the beginning of your next turn for any rogue reaction.

feat.name: Reactive Interference
feat.trigger: An adjacent enemy begins to use a reaction.
entries: Grabbing a sleeve, swiping with your weapon, or creating another obstruction, you reflexively foil an enemy's response. If the triggering creature's level is equal to or lower than yours, you disrupt the triggering reaction. If the triggering creature's level is higher than yours, you must make an attack roll against its AC. On a success, you disrupt the reaction.

feat.name: Ricochet Feint
entries: While in Ricochet Stance, you can bounce a thrown weapon off a foe to distract them. You can attempt a {@action Feint|PC1} against a creature within the first range increment of a thrown weapon you are wielding, rather than only creatures within your melee reach.

feat.name: Spring from the Shadows
entries: You leap from hiding and assail your target. You {@action Stride|PC1} up to your Speed, but you must end your movement next to an enemy you're {@condition hidden|PC1} from or {@condition undetected|PC1} by. You then {@action Strike|PC1} that enemy; you remain {@condition hidden|PC1} from or {@condition undetected|PC1} by that creature until after you {@action Strike|PC1}. You can use Spring from the Shadows while Burrowing, Climbing, Flying, or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

feat.name: Defensive Roll
feat.trigger: A physical attack would reduce you to 0 Hit Points.
entries: Dropping into a roll to disperse the force of the blow, you can partially evade a lethal attack and stay conscious. You take half damage from the triggering attack.

feat.name: Instant Opening
entries: You distract your opponent with a few choice words or a rude gesture. Choose a target within 30 feet. It's {@condition off-guard|PC1} against your attacks until the end of your next turn. Depending on the way you describe your distraction, this action gains either the {@trait auditory} or {@trait visual} trait.

feat.name: Leave an Opening
entries: When you hit hard enough, you leave an opening so your ally can jump in on the action. Whenever you critically hit an {@condition off-guard|PC1} opponent with a melee attack and deal damage, the target triggers a {@action Reactive Strike|PC1} reaction from one ally of your choice who has that reaction, as if the enemy had used a manipulate action.

feat.name: Sense the Unseen
feat.trigger: You fail a check to {@action Seek|PC1}.
entries: When you look for foes, you catch the slightest of cues. Even though you failed at the triggering check, you automatically sense any {@condition undetected|PC1} creatures in the area where you're Seeking, making them merely {@condition hidden|PC1} to you.

feat.name: Stay Down!
feat.trigger: A {@condition prone|PC1} foe within your reach Stands.
entries: You have ways of keeping your foes down. Attempt an {@skill Athletics|PC1} check against the triggering foe's Fortitude DC. On a success, the action is disrupted, causing the creature to remain {@condition prone|PC1}. On a critical success, the creature also can't {@action Stand|PC1} until its next turn.

feat.name: Blank Slate
entries: Your deceptions confound even the most powerful magic that could spy on you. {@trait Detection}, {@trait revelation}, and {@trait scrying} effects pass right over you, your possessions, and your auras, detecting nothing unless the detecting effect has a counteract rank of 10 or higher. For example, detect magic would still detect other magic in the area but not any magic on you, {@spell truesight|PC1} wouldn't reveal you, {@spell locate|PC1} or {@spell scrying|PC1} wouldn't find you, and so on.

feat.name: Cloud Step
entries: Using fantastic acrobatic skill, you can walk for brief stretches across insubstantial surfaces. When you {@action Stride|PC1}, you can move across water, air, and solid surfaces that can hold only limited weight as if they were normal ground. If you {@action Stride|PC1} over a trap with a weight-sensitive pressure plate, you don't trigger it. At the end of your turn, you sink, fall, break fragile surfaces, or trigger traps as normal for your current location.

feat.name: Cognitive Loophole
feat.trigger: Your turn ends.
feat.requirements: You are currently affected by a {@trait mental} effect.
entries: You can find a loophole in a {@trait mental} effect to temporarily overcome it. Until the end of your next turn, you ignore a single {@trait mental} effect. You can suppress a particular effect using Cognitive Loophole only once. You can't use Cognitive Loophole to suppress an effect you chose to have affect you.
special: You can use this reaction even if the {@trait mental} effect is preventing you from using reactions.

feat.name: Dispelling Slice
entries: Your sneak attack slices through the threads binding magic to a target. Make a {@action Strike|PC1} against an {@condition off-guard|PC1} creature. If your {@action Strike|PC1} deals sneak attack damage, you attempt to counteract a single spell of your choice active on the target. Your counteract rank is equal to half your level (rounded up), and your counteract check modifier is equal to your class DC – 10.

feat.name: Perfect Distraction
entries: You use clever tactics to mislead your foes as you sneak away. You {@action Sneak|PC1} while leaving a decoy behind. The decoy acts as the spell mislead, though you aren't {@condition invisible|PC1}, just {@condition undetected|PC1}.

You can continue to concentrate to move your decoy, as with the spell, whether or not you remain {@condition hidden|PC1} throughout the duration. Once you use Perfect Distraction, you need to spend 10 minutes to set up another decoy before you can use it again.

feat.name: Reconstruct the Scene
entries: You spend 1 minute surveying a small location (such as a single room) to get an impression of events that occurred there in the last day. This involves moving about the area and studying footprints, spilled drinks or blood, and so forth. You get an indistinct mental impression of significant events that happened there. This gives you clues and details of the past, including the overall events and their time frame, but it's not a perfect record. This also isn't enough to identify who was involved in these events if you weren't already aware the person was there. As determined by the GM, you also pick out various seemingly small details that could serve as important clues, like a memorable weapon someone used for a murder or the type of cloak someone wore when passing through.

feat.name: Swift Elusion
feat.trigger: A foe ends its movement adjacent to you.
entries: Attempt an {@skill Acrobatics|PC1} check against the foe's Reflex DC. If you succeed, either {@action Stride|PC1} to a different space adjacent to the foe or move the foe to a different space adjacent to you.

feat.name: Implausible Infiltration
feat.requirements: You are adjacent to a floor or vertical wall.
entries: You find tiny imperfections and somehow fit yourself through them, possibly moving directly through the wall or floor. Your movement attempt fails if the wall or floor is made of something other than wood, plaster, or stone; is thicker than 10 feet; or contains even a thin layer of metal. If you have a climb Speed, you can use this ability to attempt to move through a ceiling.

feat.name: Implausible Purchase
entries: You can use {@feat Prescient Planner|PC1} even if you have already used it after purchasing goods, and you can {@action Interact|PC1} to draw the item as a single action instead of a 2-action activity. In addition, five times per day, you can use {@feat Prescient Planner|PC1} to pull out a common consumable item up to 6 levels lower than your level.

feat.name: Powerful Sneak
entries: You've learned to exploit your enemies' openings. Your sneak attack damage ignores any immunity or resistance the target has to precision damage. In addition, when you {@action Sneak|PC1}, you can designate one creature you're {@condition undetected|PC1} by at the end of that action. On the next attack you make against that creature before the end of your next turn, any sneak attack die you roll that's less than 3 is a 3 instead. This has no benefit if your next attack against the creature doesn't deal sneak attack damage, and if you designate a new creature you lose the benefit on any previous one.

feat.name: Hidden Paragon
feat.trigger: You successfully use {@skill Stealth|PC1} to {@action Hide|PC1} and become {@condition hidden|PC1} from all of your current foes, or use {@skill Stealth|PC1} to {@action Sneak|PC1} and become {@condition undetected|PC1} to all your current foes.
entries: When you slip out of sight, you disappear. You become {@condition invisible|PC1} for 1 minute, even if you use a {@condition hostile|PC1} action. Not even {@spell revealing light|PC1}, {@spell see the unseen|PC1}, or similar effects can reveal you, though creatures can still use the {@action Seek|PC1} action to locate you as normal.

feat.name: Impossible Striker
entries: Nothing can prevent you from making a sneak attack, even if your opponent can see every blow coming. Instead of dealing the damage from {@feat Sly Striker|PC1}, you can deal your full sneak attack damage to a target even if the target isn't {@condition off-guard|PC1}.

feat.name: Reactive Distraction
feat.trigger: You would be hit by an attack or targeted by an effect, or you are within an effect's area.
feat.requirements: You have {@feat Perfect Distraction|PC1} ready to use.
entries: You reactively switch with your decoy to foil your foe. You use {@feat Perfect Distraction|PC1}, even if you were {@condition observed|PC1}, as long as you end the movement of your {@action Sneak|PC1} while {@condition concealed|PC1} or in a location with cover or greater cover. Your decoy is targeted by the attack or effect instead of you. In the case of an area effect, if your {@action Sneak|PC1} doesn't move you out of the area, both you and the decoy are targeted by the effect.

feat.name: Cackle
entries: Your patron's power fills you with confidence, letting you sustain a magical working even as a quick burst of laughter leaves your lips. You learn the {@spell cackle|PC1} hex.

feat.name: Cauldron
entries: You can brew magic in your cauldron, creating useful magical concoctions. You can use the {@action Craft|PC1} activity to create oils and potions. You immediately gain the formulas for four common 1st-level oils or potions. At 4th level and every 2 levels beyond that, you gain the formula for a common oil or potion of that level or lower (a 4th-level potion if you're 4th level, a 6th-level potion if you're 6th level, and so on). If you have a familiar, you can have your familiar learn these formulas rather than storing them in a formula book. Your familiar can learn new formulas in the same way it learns new spells, and these formulas are transferred from a slain familiar to a new familiar in the same way spells are.

During your daily preparations, you can create one temporary oil or potion using a formula you know. If you have master proficiency in spell DC, you can create a batch of two temporary oils or potions during your daily preparations, and if you have legendary proficiency, you can create a batch of three. Any items you create this way become inert bottles of liquid the next time you make your daily preparations, and any remaining effects of the temporary items end. A temporary oil or potion has no value.

feat.name: Counterspell
feat.trigger: A creature Casts a Spell that you have prepared.
entries: When a foe Casts a Spell and you can see its manifestations, you can use your magic to disrupt it. You expend a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. You lose your spell slot as if you had cast the triggering spell. You then attempt to counteract the triggering spell.
special: This feat has the trait corresponding to the tradition of spells you cast (arcane, divine, primal, or occult).

feat.name: Reach Spell
entries: You can extend the range of your spells. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet. As is standard for increasing spell ranges, if the spell normally has a range of touch, you extend its range to 30 feet.

feat.name: Widen Spell
entries: You manipulate the energy of your spell, causing it to affect a wider area. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and doesn't have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius isn't affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

feat.name: Witch's Armaments
entries: Your patron's power changes your body to ensure you are never defenseless. You gain one of the following unarmed attacks.

items: {@b Eldritch Nails} Your nails are supernaturally long and sharp. You gain a nails unarmed attack that deals {@damage 1d6} slashing damage, is in the brawling group, and has the {@trait agile} and {@trait unarmed} traits.
{@b Iron Teeth} With a click of your jaw, your teeth transform into long metallic points. You gain a jaws unarmed attack that deals {@damage 1d8} piercing damage and is in the brawling group.

{@b Living Hair} You can instantly grow or shrink your hair, eyebrows, beard, or mustache by up to several feet and manipulate your hair for use as a weapon, though your control isn't fine enough for more dexterous tasks. You gain a hair unarmed attack that deals {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage; is in the brawling group; and has the {@trait agile}, {@trait disarm}, {@trait finesse}, {@trait trip}, and {@trait unarmed} traits.

special: You can take this feat more than once, gaining a different unarmed attack each time.

feat.name: Basic Lesson
entries: Your patron grants you a special lesson, revealing a hidden facet of its nature. Choose a {@filter basic lesson|optionalfeatures|PC1|Feature Type=Basic Lesson} from the list. You gain its associated hex, and your familiar learns the associated spell.

feat.name: Cantrip Expansion
entries: Your patron recognizes your need for flexibility and versatility, and grants you the power to prepare a wider range of simple spells. You can prepare two additional cantrips each day.

feat.name: Conceal Spell
entries: Through sheer mental effort, you can simplify the incantations and gestures needed to spellcast, leaving them barely noticeable. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1}, the spell gains the {@trait subtle} trait, hiding the shining runes, sparks of magic, and other manifestations that would usually give away your spellcasting. The trait hides only the spell's spellcasting actions and manifestations, not its effects, so an observer might still see a ray streak out from you or see you vanish into thin air.

feat.name: Enhanced Familiar
entries: You infuse your familiar with additional magical energy. You can select four familiar or master abilities each day instead of two.
special: Add the bonus familiar abilities you gain for being a witch to this amount.

feat.name: Familiar's Language
entries: You've learned to speak with your familiar and other creatures like it. You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the {@skill Diplomacy|PC1} skill with creatures of the same family of animals as your familiar. For example, if your familiar were a cat, you could gain the effects of speak with animals for any felines (including leopards, lions, and tigers, among others). This ability doesn't make them more {@condition friendly|PC1} than normal.
If your familiar ever changes to a different creature, you can't use this ability for 1 week while you absorb your new familiar's language.
special: This feat has the trait corresponding to the tradition of spells you cast (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

feat.name: Rites of Convocation
entries: Your patron grants you the power to summon other creatures to aid you. Choose one summon spell (such as {@spell summon animal|PC1}, {@spell summon construct|PC1}, and so forth) that appears on the spell list of your spellcasting tradition. You can spend 10 minutes in communion with your familiar to replace one spell you've prepared in one of your witch spell slots with the spell you chose, heightened to the same rank. The spell you replaced must be of at least the summon spell's minimum spell rank.

feat.name: Sympathetic Strike
entries: You collect your patron's magic into one of your witch armaments, causing them to shine with runes, light, or another signifier of your patron. Make an unarmed {@action Strike|PC1} with one with your witch's armaments. If you hit, you establish a sympathetic link with the target, making it easier for your patron to affect them. Until the beginning of your next turn, the target takes a –1 circumstance penalty to its saves against your hexes, or a –2 penalty if the triggering {@action Strike|PC1} was a critical hit.

feat.name: Ceremonial Knife
entries: You have prepared a special knife to direct energies when spellcasting. During your daily preparations, you and your familiar can perform a short ritual over a weapon in the knife group—typically a dagger. This causes the knife to function as a magic wand, containing any one 1st-rank spell your familiar knows. You, and only you, can Activate the knife to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1|Cast the Spell} within it, as normal for a wand (GM Core 282). You can attempt to overcharge the knife, and this can break or destroy the knife as normal.
At 8th level, and every 2 levels thereafter, the maximum rank of spell your ceremonial knife can hold increases by 1.

feat.name: Greater Lesson
entries: Your patron grants you greater knowledge. Choose a {@filter greater or basic lesson|optionalfeatures|PC1|Feature Type=Basic Lesson;Greater Lesson}. You gain its associated hex, and your familiar learns the associated spell.

feat.name: Steady Spellcasting
entries: Confident in your technique, you don't easily lose your concentration when you {@action Cast a Spell|PC1}. If another creature's reaction would disrupt your spellcasting action, attempt a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check. If you succeed, your action isn't disrupted.

feat.name: Witch's Charge
entries: You forge a magical link with another creature, granting you awareness of that creature's condition and creating a conduit for spellcasting. During your daily preparations, you can designate one willing creature as your charge. You are always aware of your charge's direction from you, its distance from you, and any conditions affecting it. In addition, you can cast spells with a range of touch on your charge from a range of 30 feet. These effects persist until your next daily preparations.
special: This feat has the trait corresponding to the tradition of spells you cast (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

feat.name: Incredible Familiar
entries: Your familiar is imbued with even more magic than other familiars. You can select a base of six familiar or master abilities each day, instead of four.
special: Add the bonus familiar abilities you gain for being a witch to this amount.

feat.name: Murksight
entries: Your vision pierces through non-magical fog, mist, rain, and snow. You don't take circumstance penalties to ranged attacks or {@skill Perception|PC1} checks caused by non-magical precipitation, and your targeted attacks don't require a flat check to succeed against a target {@condition concealed|PC1} only by such effects.

feat.name: Spirit Familiar
entries: Your familiar can subsume its body to become pure spirit. Your familiar gains the Shed Spirit activity.

entries.name: Shed Spirit
entries: Your familiar's spirit exits its body, leaving its empty shell behind, before flying at an enemy within 20 feet and dealing {@damage 6d6} spirit damage, with a basic Will save against your spell DC. If the familiar dealt damage, it then flies to an ally within 30 feet of the enemy, restoring Hit Points equal to half the damage dealt. Your familiar then re-forms in its original square. At 9th level, and every 2 levels thereafter, the attack deals an additional {@dice 2d6} damage.

feat.name: Stitched Familiar
entries: Your familiar can shed its material form, becoming a mass of animated magic. Your familiar gains the Stitching Strike activity.

entries.name: Stitching Strike
entries: Your familiar unravels into magical fibers that encompass an enemy within 30 feet and deal {@damage 6d6} slashing damage, with a basic Reflex save against your spell DC. On a failure, the target is also {@condition immobilized|PC1} for 1 round or until it Escapes against your spell DC. Your familiar then re-forms in its original square. At 9th level, and every 2 levels thereafter, the attack deals an additional {@dice 2d6} damage.

feat.name: Witch's Bottle
entries: You spend 10 minutes and 1 Focus Point brewing a special potion containing the power of one of your hexes that targets a creature. A creature that consumes this potion is targeted by the hex. If the hex has a sustained duration and you have {@spell cackle|PC1}, you can cast {@spell cackle|PC1} into the bottle just before you seal it. If you do, the hex's duration is extended as if you had cast {@spell cackle|PC1} the round after the hex was cast (typically this extends the duration by 1 round). Your cackling laugh sounds out when the potion is unsealed.

Any potion you create this way loses its power the next time you make your daily preparations. While the potion is in your possession, you can render it inert using a single action that has the {@trait concentrate} trait. You can't regain the Focus Point you spent to create the potion (or the Focus Point you spent to cast {@spell cackle|PC1}) until the potion is consumed or loses its magic

feat.name: Double, Double
entries: For each temporary oil or potion you brew during your daily preparations, you brew two copies of it. This allows you to brew two temporary oils or potions each day, four if you have master proficiency in spell DC, or six if you have legendary proficiency.

feat.name: Major Lesson
entries: Your patron grants you even greater secrets. Choose a {@filter major, greater, or basic lesson|optionalfeatures||Feature Type=Basic Lesson;Greater Lesson;Major Lesson}. You gain its associated hex, and your familiar learns the associated spell.
special: You can select this feat a second time if you're 14th level or higher, and a third time if you're 18th level or higher. Choose a different lesson each time.

feat.name: Quickened Casting
entries: You accelerate your spellcasting. If your next action is to cast a witch cantrip or a witch spell that is at least 2 ranks lower than the highest-rank witch spell slot you have, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

feat.name: Witch's Communion
entries: You can keep watch over multiple charges. Each day during your preparations, you can designate a number of charges equal to your Intelligence modifier instead of just one.

feat.name: Coven Spell
feat.trigger: An ally within 30 feet Casts a Spell.
entries: You rhyme with your ally's incantations or echo their movements, linking your magic to empower their spell in one of two ways:

items: If their spell deals damage and doesn't have a duration, you grant that spell a status bonus to damage equal to its rank.

If their spell doesn't have a {@trait spellshape} effect applied to it, apply the effects of any one spellshape feat you know to the spell. The spellshape feat must be one that can be applied to the triggering spell, and you must be able to use it (for instance, if the spellshape feat is usable only a limited number of times per day).

feat.name: Hex Focus
entries: Your patron's teachings have allowed you to achieve a deeper focus. Whenever you {@action Refocus|PC1}, completely refill your focus pool.

feat.name: Witch's Broom
entries: A broom is the only steed you need to fly through the night sky. During your daily preparations, you can anoint a single broom, staff, polearm, or similarly shaped object with a flying ointment made of special herbs and oils. Until the next time you make your daily preparations, it gains the {@trait magical} trait, and you can ride on it while you're holding it with at least 1 hand. It moves at a fly Speed of 20 feet. The broom takes a –10-foot penalty to its Speed if laden with more than 20 Bulk, and crashes to the ground if it carries more than 30 Bulk. The broom can't be controlled by anyone but you. If you anoint a weapon or other held item, you can't ride the broom and wield it at the same time.

You can {@action Craft|PC1} your broomstick into a {@item flying broomstick|GMC} as though you had the formula for that item. If you anoint an item that's already a {@item flying broomstick|GMC}, the broom gains a +10-foot status bonus to its Speed and you can choose whether it works for anyone or only you.

feat.name: Reflect Spell
entries: When you successfully use {@feat Counterspell (Witch)|PC1} to counteract a spell that affects targeted creatures or an area, you can turn that spell's effect back on its caster. When reflected, the spell affects only the original caster, even if it's an area spell or it would normally affect more than one creature. The original caster can attempt a save and use other defenses against the reflected spell as normal.

feat.name: Rites of Transfiguration
entries: You can adapt your patron's power to transform other creatures into forms more befitting their behavior or your whims. Your familiar learns {@spell cursed metamorphosis|PC1}, even if {@spell cursed metamorphosis|PC1} isn't on your tradition's spell list. By spending 10 minutes in communion with your familiar, you can replace one spell of 6th-rank or higher you've prepared in one of your witch spell slots with a {@spell cursed metamorphosis|PC1} spell of the same rank.

feat.name: Patron's Presence
entries: Your patron can direct its attention through your familiar, and its mere presence becomes an ominous weight on the minds of other beings to distract them and blot out their magic. Your familiar gains the following activity.

entries.name: Patron's Presence
entries: A palpable weight extends from your familiar in a 15-foot emanation. Enemies who enter or start their turn within the aura must succeed at a Will save against your spell DC or become {@condition stupefied||stupefied 2} as long as they remain within the aura, or {@condition stupefied||stupefied 3} on a critical failure. The aura lasts until the end of your next turn, but the familiar can {@action Sustain|PC1} it up to 1 minute.

feat.name: Effortless Concentration
feat.trigger: Your turn begins.
entries: You maintain your active spells with hardly a thought. You immediately gain the effects of a {@action Sustain|PC1} action for one of your active witch spells.

feat.name: Siphon Power
feat.requirements: You haven't acted yet on your turn.
entries: You draw upon the reservoir of your patron's magic that resides within your familiar. During your turn, you can cast one spell your familiar knows that was granted by your patron or lessons without spending a spell slot to do so (or even having it prepared). The spell must be at least 1 rank lower than your highest-rank witch spell slot.
special: This feat has the trait corresponding to the tradition of spells you cast ({@trait arcane}, {@trait divine}, {@trait occult}, or {@trait primal}).

feat.name: Split Hex
entries: You siphon some of the power from an offensive hex you cast to direct it at a second target as well. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} to cast a harmful hex with a single target, reduce its rank by 2 (making it 2 ranks lower than the maximum spell rank you can cast). If you do, you can select a second target for that hex to affect.

feat.name: Patron's Claim
entries: Your patron partially manifests itself through your familiar to claim a foe's power for its own. Your familiar gains the following activity.

entries.name: Patron's Claim
entries: Your familiar's mouth opens impossibly wide before your patron's grasping limb stretches forth from it at a creature within 30 feet, dealing {@damage 10d10} spirit damage with a basic Fortitude save against your spell DC. If the creature fails its save and takes damage, it is also {@condition drained||drained 2} (or {@condition drained||drained 4} on a critical failure) and you regain 1 Focus Point, up to your usual maximum, as your patron grants you additional magic in exchange for your gift of your opponent's spirit.

feat.name: Hex Master
entries: You embody the link to your patron so completely that you can cast your hexes in rapid succession. You are no longer limited to casting only a single hex each turn. In addition, when you cast {@spell cackle|PC1} to sustain a hex, you gain the effects of {@action Sustain|PC1} for all your active hexes that have a duration of sustained.

feat.name: Patron's Truth
entries: You have mastered the greatest secrets of your patron's magic and learned a fundamental truth about your patron, even if their identity still remains a mystery. You gain an additional 10th-rank spell slot.

feat.name: Witch's Hut
entries: Your home is an animated structure that obeys your commands. By performing a rite that takes 1 day, you create an animated object from a hut, small house, covered wagon, tent, or similar construction of up to Huge size.

The hut uses your AC, saving throw modifiers, and {@skill Perception|PC1} modifier and has 150 HP and Hardness 10. It has the construct armor ability, meaning once it's reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its AC is reduced by 4 until it is repaired.

The hut can't attack or attempt skill checks. You can give the hut a command as a single action, which has the {@trait auditory} and {@trait concentrate} traits; after 1 round of reconfiguring itself, the hut then follows that command until you give it a different command.

items: {@b Guard} The hut watches for trespassers within 120 feet using your {@skill Perception|PC1} modifier and screams if it spots any.
{@b Hide} The hut appears to be a normal, mundane object of its type. This is a 10th-rank {@trait illusion} effect.
{@b Leap} The hut spins around or leaps into the air, then casts 10th-rank {@spell teleport|PC1}, transporting itself and all creatures within it.
{@b Lock} With a slam, each entrance to the hut becomes sealed with a {@spell lock|PC1} spell. You can give this command again to unlock its entrances.

{@b Move} The hut gains a Speed of 60 feet, growing giant bird or bone legs, if necessary, and follows an extremely basic movement command you give it, such as "follow me" or "move that direction. " While perfectly suitable for overland travel, the hut's broad movements and 1-round delay on response time are too imprecise to predictably direct in a combat encounter or other situation where seconds and precise locations count. You can have only one witch's hut at a time. If you animate a new hut, your previous hut immediately reverts to its original, mundane form. If you die, the hut continues following the last order you gave it indefinitely.

feat.name: Counterspell
feat.trigger: A creature Casts a Spell that you have prepared.
entries: When a foe Casts a Spell and you can see its manifestations, you can use your own magic to counter it. You expend a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. You lose your spell slot as if you had cast the triggering spell. You then attempt to counteract the triggering spell.

feat.name: Familiar
entries: You make a pact with a creature that serves you and assists your spellcasting. You gain a familiar.

feat.name: Reach Spell
entries: You can extend the range of your spells. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet. As is standard for increasing spell ranges, if the spell normally has a range of touch, you extend its range to 30 feet.

feat.name: Spellbook Prodigy
entries: You are particularly adept at learning spells to add to your spellbook. You gain the {@feat Magical Shorthand|PC1} skill feat without needing to meet its prerequisites. Further, when you roll a critical failure on your check to {@action Learn a Spell|PC1}, you get a failure instead.

feat.name: Widen Spell
entries: You manipulate the energy of your spell, causing it to affect a wider area. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and does not have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

feat.name: Cantrip Expansion
entries: Dedicated study allows you to prepare a wider range of simple spells for every situation. You can prepare two additional cantrips each day.

feat.name: Conceal Spell
entries: By shaping the magical energies and parameters of your spells all in your head through sheer concentration, you can simplify the incantations and gestures needed to spellcast, leaving them barely noticeable. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1}, the spell gains the {@trait subtle} trait, hiding the shining runes, sparks of magic, and other manifestations that would usually give away your spellcasting. The trait hides only the spell's spellcasting actions and manifestations, not its effects, so an observer might still see a ray streak out from you or see you vanish into thin air.

feat.name: Energy Ablation
entries: As you direct destructive energy at a foe, you can divert some of its power into a protective barrier that shields you from harm. If your next action is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} that deals at least one type of energy damage (acid, cold, electricity, fire, force, sonic, vitality, or void), you gain resistance to an energy damage type of your choice equal to the spell's rank.
The resistance lasts until the end of your next turn. You get the resistance regardless of whether or not your spell dealt damage.

feat.name: Enhanced Familiar
entries: You infuse your familiar with additional magical energy. You can select four familiar or master abilities each day, instead of two.
special: If your arcane thesis is improved familiar attunement, your familiar's base number of familiar abilities, before adding any extra abilities from the arcane thesis, is four.

feat.name: Nonlethal Spell
entries: You can alter offensive spells to be less deadly. If your next action is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} that deals damage and doesn't have the {@trait death} or {@trait void} trait, that spell gains the {@trait nonlethal} trait.

feat.name: Bespell Strikes
feat.requirements: Your most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip spell.
entries: You siphon spell energy into one weapon you're wielding, or into one of your unarmed attacks, such as a fist. Until the end of your turn, the weapon or unarmed attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage and gains the {@trait arcane} trait if it didn't have it already. If the spell dealt a different type of damage, the {@action Strike|PC1} deals this type of damage instead (or one type of your choice if the spell could deal multiple types of damage).

feat.name: Call Wizardly Tools
entries: You're mystically connected to your wizardly tools, ensuring you can always find them when you've misplaced them. You teleport your bonded item or spellbook to you.
It arrives in your hand if you have a free hand or at your feet if you don't. The item must be within 1 mile and have 1 Bulk or less.

feat.name: Linked Focus
entries: You have linked your bonded item to the well of energy that powers your school spells. Once per day when you Drain your Bonded Item to cast one of your arcane school's curriculum spells, you also regain 1 Focus Point.

feat.name: Spell Protection Array
entries: You inscribe a circle of arcane runes that dampen enemies' magic. You create a glowing magic circle in a 5-foot burst within 30 feet. Creatures in the circle gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws against magic. The circle lasts until the end of your next turn, and you can Sustain it, to a maximum duration of 1 minute.

feat.name: Convincing Illusion
feat.trigger: A creature succeeded, but didn't critically succeed, at a
entries: {@skill Perception|PC1} check or Will save to disbelieve an illusion from a spell that you cast.

feat.name: Explosive Arrival
entries: Your {@trait summoned} creature appears in a detonation of arcane runes. If your next action is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} with the {@trait summon} trait, all creatures in a 10-foot emanation around the creature you summoned take {@damage 1d4} fire damage per spell rank. If the creature summoned has the acid, cold, electricity, {@trait sonic}, or {@trait spirit} trait, you can deal damage of that type instead.

feat.name: Irresistible Magic
entries: You've studied ways of overcoming the innate defenses against magic that dragons, otherworldly beings, and certain other powerful creatures have. Any creature that has a status bonus to saving throws against magic reduces that bonus by 1 against your spells.

feat.name: Split Slot
entries: You can prepare two spells in one slot, giving you the freedom to choose the spell when you cast it. When you prepare your spells for the day, you can choose one spell slot at least 1 rank lower than the highest-rank spell you can cast and prepare two spells in that slot. When you {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} from that slot, choose which spell to cast. Once you've chosen, the unused spell dissipates as though you hadn't prepared it at all—for example, it isn't available for use with {@action Drain Bonded Item|PC1}.

feat.name: Steady Spellcasting
entries: Confident in your technique and possessing ironclad concentration, you don't easily lose your concentration when you {@action Cast a Spell|PC1}. If a reaction would disrupt your spellcasting action, attempt a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check. If you succeed, your action isn't disrupted.

feat.name: Advanced School Spell
entries: You gain access to the advanced teachings of your arcane institution, learning a powerful new school spell. You gain the advanced school spell for your arcane school.

feat.name: Bond Conservation
feat.requirements: The last action you used was to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} enabled by {@action Drain Bonded Item|PC1}.
entries: By efficiently and carefully manipulating the arcane energies unleashed by your bonded item, you can conserve just enough power to cast another spell, though this second spell is slightly weaker. You gain an extra use of {@action Drain Bonded Item|PC1}. You can use it to cast a spell 2 or more ranks lower than the previous spell, and must use it before the end of your next turn or you lose it.

feat.name: Form Retention
entries: You have trained your mind and body to tolerate polymorph magic for longer periods of time, so long as you prepare for the change appropriately. When preparing a polymorph spell that lasts 1 minute and grants a battle form, you can prepare the spell in a slot 2 ranks higher than normal. This doesn't grant any of the normal benefits of heightening a spell, but the spell lasts up to 10 minutes. For example, if you prepared animal form in a 4th-rank slot with Form Retention, you would cast a 2nd-rank animal form that lasts for up to 10 minutes. If the spell can be Dismissed, that doesn't change.

feat.name: Knowledge Is Power
entries: Your academic knowledge about a creature allows you to subtly alter your magic to defeat them. When you critically succeed at a {@action Recall Knowledge|PC1} check about a creature, you can invoke your knowledge to make the creature take a –1 circumstance penalty to either AC and saves against the next attack you make against it, or the next spell you cast that it needs to defend against. The creature takes the same penalty to its attack or DC the next time it attacks against you or causes you to attempt a save against one of its effects.
If you share this information with your allies, they gain the benefits as well. If not used, the bonuses end after 1 minute.

feat.name: Overwhelming Energy
entries: Multiple circles of runes rotate around your hand as you overcharge your spell to tear through your enemy's defenses. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1}, the spell ignores an amount of the target's resistance to acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage equal to your level. This applies to all damage the spell deals, including {@condition persistent damage|PC1} and damage caused by an ongoing effect of the spell, such as the wall created by {@spell wall of fire|PC1}. A creature's immunities are unaffected.

feat.name: Quickened Casting
entries: Straining your mind, you collapse as much of your spell's formulas as you can, resulting in a shorter but much more complex incantation. If your next action is to cast a wizard cantrip or a wizard spell that is at least 2 ranks lower than the highest-rank wizard spell slot you have, reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action).

feat.name: Scroll Adept
entries: During your daily preparations, you can create two temporary scrolls containing arcane spells from your spellbook. Each scroll must be of a different spell rank, and both spell ranks must be 2 or more ranks lower than your highest-rank spell. Any scrolls you create this way become non-magical the next time you make your daily preparations. A temporary scroll has no value if sold. As normal for a scroll, these are consumable items of light Bulk, and someone holding the item in one hand can {@action Cast a Spell|PC1|Cast the Spell} from it if it's on their spell list, using their spell attack modifier and spell DC.
If you have master proficiency in spell DC, you can create three temporary scrolls during your daily preparations, and if you have legendary proficiency, you can create four temporary scrolls.

feat.name: Clever Counterspell
entries: You creatively apply your prepared spells to {@feat Counterspell (Wizard)|PC1} a much wider variety of your opponents' magic. Instead of being able to counter a foe's spell with {@feat Counterspell (Wizard)|PC1} only if you have that same spell prepared, you can use {@feat Counterspell (Wizard)|PC1} as long as you have the spell the foe is casting in your spellbook. When you use {@feat Counterspell (Wizard)|PC1} in this way, you must still expend a prepared spell; the prepared spell you expend must share a trait with the triggering spell other than {@trait concentrate}, {@trait manipulate}, or its tradition trait. The GM might allow you to instead use a spell that has an opposing trait or that otherwise logically would counter the triggering spell (such as using a cold or water spell to counter {@spell fireball|PC1} or using {@spell clear mind|PC1} to counter a {@spell fear|PC1} spell).

feat.name: Forcible Energy
entries: You perform complex manipulations to make the energy from your spells so powerful that your enemies remain vulnerable to it afterward. If your next action is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} that deals acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage, you can select one target that was damaged to gain weakness 5 to that damage type until the end of your next turn. If a spell deals multiple types of energy damage, choose one that the target gains weakness to. This has no effect on creatures with resistance or immunity to the energy type you choose.

feat.name: Keen Magical Detection
entries: You sense magical dangers. When using the {@action Detect Magic|PC1} exploration activity, you can roll initiative twice and use the better result so long as at least one opponent has a {@trait magical} effect or magic item and is in range of your {@spell detect magic|PC1}.

feat.name: Magic Sense
entries: You have a literal sixth sense for ambient magic in your vicinity. You can sense the presence of magic auras as though you were always using a 1st-rank {@spell detect magic|PC1} spell. This detects magic in your field of vision only. When you {@action Seek|PC1}, you gain the benefits of a 3rd-rank {@spell detect magic|PC1} spell on things you see (in addition to the normal benefits of Seeking). You can turn this sense off and on with a free action at the start or the end of your turn.

feat.name: Bonded Focus
entries: Your connection to your bonded item increases your focus pool. Whenever you {@action Refocus|PC1} while your bonded item is in your possession, you completely refill your focus pool.

feat.name: Reflect Spell
entries: When you successfully use {@feat Counterspell (Wizard)|PC1} to counteract a spell that affects targeted creatures or an area, you can turn that spell's effect back on its caster. When reflected, the spell affects only the original caster, even if it's an area spell or it would normally affect more than one creature. The original caster can attempt a save and use other defenses against the reflected spell as normal.

feat.name: Secondary Detonation Array
entries: You divert some of your spell's energy into an unstable runic array. If your next action is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} that deals damage, has no duration, and affects an area, a glowing magic circle appears in a 5-foot burst within that area. At the beginning of your next turn, the circle detonates, dealing {@damage 1d6} force damage per rank of the spell to all creatures within the circle, with a basic Reflex save against your spell DC. If the spell dealt a different type of damage, the circle deals this type of damage instead (or one type of your choice if the spell could deal multiple types of damage).

feat.name: Superior Bond
entries: When you draw upon your bonded item, you can leave a bit of energy within it for later use. You can use {@action Drain Bonded Item|PC1} one additional time per day, but only to cast a spell 2 or more ranks lower than your highest-rank wizard spell slot.

feat.name: Effortless Concentration
feat.trigger: Your turn begins.
entries: You maintain your active spells with hardly a thought. You immediately gain the effects of a Sustain action for one of your active wizard spells.

feat.name: Scintillating Spell
entries: Your spells become a radiant display of light and color. If your next action is to {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} that doesn't have the {@trait darkness} trait, has no duration, and requires creatures to attempt a Reflex save, the spell explodes in a spray of scintillating lights, in addition to its other effects. Each creature that failed its Reflex save against the spell is {@condition dazzled|PC1} for 1 round, and those who critically failed are instead {@condition blinded|PC1} for 1 round.

feat.name: Spell Tinker
entries: You've learned to alter choices you make when casting spells on yourself. After casting a spell on only yourself that offers several choices of effect (such as resist energy or a polymorph spell that offers several potential forms), you can alter the choice you made when Casting the Spell (for instance, choosing a different type of damage for resist energy).

You can't use this feat if the benefits of the spell have already been used up or if the effects of the first choice would persist in any way after switching (for instance, if one of the choices was to create a consumable item you already used, or to heal you), or if the feat would create an effect more powerful than that offered by the base spell. The GM is the final arbiter of what Spell Tinker can be applied to.

feat.name: Infinite Possibilities
entries: You can prepare a spell slot that exists in your mind as many different possibilities at once. Once during your daily preparations, you can use a spell slot to hold that infinite potential, rather than using it to prepare a spell. You can use this spell slot to cast any spell from your spellbook that's at least 2 ranks lower than the slot you designate; the spell acts in all ways as a spell of 2 ranks lower. You don't have any particular spell prepared in that slot until you cast it.

feat.name: Reprepare Spell
entries: You've discovered how to reuse some of your spell slots over and over. You can spend 10 minutes to prepare a spell that you already cast today, regaining access to that spell slot. The spell must be of 4th rank or lower and can't have a duration. You can reprepare a spell in this way even if you've already reprepared that spell previously in the same day.

If you have the spell substitution arcane thesis, you can instead prepare a different spell in an expended slot, as long as the new spell doesn't have a duration. You can use spell substitution on that slot again, but you remain restricted to preparing only spells without a duration in that slot until the next time you make your daily preparations.

feat.name: Second Thoughts
feat.trigger: You cast a mental spell that targets one creature, and it critically succeeds at its Will save.
entries: When your target proves resilient to your magical deceptions, you can try them again on someone else. You can Cast the triggering Spell a second time, targeting a different creature, without expanding an additional spell slot. You can do so only until the end of your next turn, and you can't use Second Thoughts on it after the second casting of the spell.

feat.name: Archwizard's Might
entries: You have mastered the greatest secrets of arcane magic. You gain an additional 10th-rank spell slot.

feat.name: Spell Combination
entries: You can merge spells, producing multiple effects with a single casting. One slot of each rank of spell you can cast, except 2nd rank and 1st rank, becomes a spell combination slot (this doesn't apply to cantrips). When you prepare your spells, you can fill a combination slot with a combination of two spells. Each spell in the combination must be 2 or more spell ranks below the slot's rank, and both must target only one creature or object or have the option to target only one creature or object. Each spell in the combination must also have the same means of determining whether it has an effect—both spells must require a ranged spell attack, require the same type of saving throw, or automatically affect the target.

When you cast a combined spell, it affects only one target, even if the component spells normally affect more than one. If any spell in the combination has further restrictions (such as targeting only living creatures), you must abide by all restrictions. The combined spell uses the shorter of the component spells' ranges. Resolve a combined spell as if were a single spell, but apply the effects of both component spells. For example, if the spell's target succeeded at the save against a combined spell, it would apply the success effect of each spell, and if it critically failed, it would apply the critical failure effect of both spells.

feat.name: Spell Mastery
entries: You have mastered a handful of spells to such a degree that you can cast them even if you haven't prepared them in advance. Select any four spells of 9th rank or lower that are in your spellbook; each spell you select must be of a different rank. These spells are automatically prepared when you make your daily preparations, and you gain an extra spell slot for each spell. You can select a different combination of spells by spending 1 week of downtime studying your spellbook and retraining your mastered spells.

feat.name: Spellshape Mastery
entries: Your mastery of magic ensures that you can alter your spells just as easily as you can cast them normally. You can use spellshape single actions as free actions.

feat.name: Bard Dedication
entries: You cast spells like a bard and gain the {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} activity.

You gain a spell repertoire with two common cantrips from the occult spell list or any other occult cantrips you've learned or discovered. You're trained in the spell attack modifier and spell DC statistics. Your key spellcasting attribute for bard archetype spells is Charisma, and they are occult bard spells.
You become trained in {@skill Occultism|PC1} and {@skill Performance|PC1}; for each of these skills in which you were already trained, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.
Choose a muse as you would if you were a bard. You can take that muse's feats, but you don't gain the starting feat, spell or any other abilities the choice of muse grants.

feat.name: Basic Bard Spellcasting
entries: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits. Each time you gain a spell slot of a new rank from the bard archetype, add a common occult spell of the appropriate rank, or another appropriate occult spell you learned or discovered, to your repertoire.

feat.name: Basic Muse's Whispers
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level bard|feats||Class=bard|level=[1;2]} feat.

feat.name: Advanced Muse's Whispers
entries: You gain one {@filter bard|feats||Class=bard|level=[1;10]} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your bard level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter bard|feats||Class=bard|level=[1;10]} feat.

feat.name: Counter Perform
entries: You gain the {@spell counter performance|PC1} composition spell. This is a focus spell, granting you a focus pool or expanding that pool. You can {@action Refocus|PC1} by engaging your muse.

feat.name: Anthemic Performance
entries: Your music, speech, or other performance inspires your allies to dive into battle. You gain the {@spell courageous anthem|PC1} composition cantrip.

feat.name: Occult Breadth
entries: Your repertoire expands, and you can cast more occult spells each day. Increase the number of spells in your repertoire and the number of spell slots you gain from bard archetype feats by 1 for each spell rank other than your two highest bard spell slots.

feat.name: Expert Bard Spellcasting
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Basic Bard Spellcasting|PC1}, master in {@skill Occultism|PC1}
entries: You gain the expert spellcasting benefits.

feat.name: Master Bard Spellcasting
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Expert Bard Spellcasting|PC1}, legendary in {@skill Occultism|PC1}
entries: You gain the master spellcasting benefits.

feat.name: Cleric Dedication
entries: You cast spells like a cleric. You gain the {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} activity. You can prepare two common cantrips each day from the divine spell list or any other divine cantrips you have access to. You're trained in the spell attack modifier and spell DC statistics. Your key spellcasting attribute for cleric archetype spells is Wisdom, and they are divine cleric spells.

Choose a deity as you would if you were a cleric. You become bound by that deity's anathema and can receive that deity's divine sanctification. You become trained in {@skill Religion|PC1} and your deity's associated skill; for each of these skills in which you were already trained, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You don't gain any other abilities from your choice of deity.

feat.name: Basic Cleric Spellcasting
entries: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits. You can prepare your deity's spells in your spell slots of the appropriate rank from the cleric archetype.

feat.name: Basic Dogma
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level cleric|feats||Class=cleric|level=[1;2]} feat.

feat.name: Advanced Dogma
entries: You gain one {@filter cleric|feats||Class=cleric|level=[1;10]} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your cleric level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter cleric|feats||Class=cleric|level=[1;10]} feat.

feat.name: Divine Breadth
entries: As your understanding increases, your god grants you more divine spells each day. Increase the spell slots you gain from cleric archetype feats by 1 for each spell rank other than your two highest cleric spell slots.

feat.name: Expert Cleric Spellcasting
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Basic Cleric Spellcasting|PC1}, master in {@skill Religion|PC1}
entries: You gain the expert spellcasting benefits.

feat.name: Master Cleric Spellcasting
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Expert Cleric Spellcasting|PC1}, legendary in {@skill Religion|PC1}
entries: You gain the master spellcasting benefits.

feat.name: Druid Dedication
entries: You cast spells like a druid. You gain the {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} activity. You can prepare two common cantrips each day from the primal spell list or any other primal cantrips you learn or discover. You're trained in the spell attack modifier and spell DC statistics. Your key spellcasting attribute for druid archetype spells is Wisdom, and they are primal druid spells.
You learn the {@language Wildsong|PC1} language, and you are bound by the druid's anathema.

Choose a druidic order. You become a member of that order and are also bound by its specific anathema, allowing you to take the order's feats. You become trained in {@skill Nature|PC1} and your order's associated skill; for each of these skills in which you were already trained, you become trained in a skill of your choice. You don't gain any other abilities from your choice of order.

feat.name: Basic Druid Spellcasting
entries: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.

feat.name: Basic Wilding
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level druid|feats||Class=druid|level=[1;2]} feat.

feat.name: Order Spell
entries: You gain the initial order spell from your order. This is a focus spell, granting you a focus pool or expanding that pool. You can {@action Refocus|PC1} by being one with nature.

feat.name: Advanced Wilding
entries: You gain one {@filter druid|feats||Class=druid|level=[1;10]} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your druid level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter druid|feats||Class=druid|level=[1;10]} feat.

feat.name: Primal Breadth
entries: Increase the spell slots you gain from druid archetype feats by 1 for each spell rank other than your two highest druid spell slots.

feat.name: Expert Druid Spellcasting
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Basic Druid Spellcasting|PC1}, master in {@skill Nature|PC1}
entries: You gain the expert spellcasting benefits.

feat.name: Master Druid Spellcasting
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Expert Druid Spellcasting|PC1}, legendary in {@skill Nature|PC1}
entries: You gain the master spellcasting benefits.

feat.name: Fighter Dedication
entries: You become trained in martial weapons. You become trained in your choice of {@skill Acrobatics|PC1} or {@skill Athletics|PC1}; if you are already trained in both of these skills, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You become trained in fighter class DC.

feat.name: Basic Maneuver
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level fighter|feats||Class=fighter|level=[1;2]} feat.

feat.name: Fighter Resiliency
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Fighter Dedication|PC1}, class granting no more Hit
entries: Points per level than 8 + your Constitution modifier You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each fighter archetype class feat you have. As you continue selecting fighter archetype class feats, you continue to gain additional Hit Points in this way.

feat.name: Reactive Striker
entries: You gain the {@action Reactive Strike|PC1} reaction.

feat.name: Advanced Maneuver
entries: You gain a {@filter fighter|feats||Class=fighter|level=[1;10]} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your fighter level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter fighter|feats||Class=fighter|level=[1;10]} feat.

feat.name: Diverse Weapon Expert
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Fighter Dedication|PC1}, expert in any kind of weapon or unarmed attack
entries: Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons and martial weapons increase to expert, and your proficiency rank for advanced weapons increases to trained.

feat.name: Ranger Dedication
entries: You become trained in {@skill Survival|PC1}; if you were already trained in {@skill Survival|PC1}, you instead become trained in another skill of your choice. You become trained in ranger class DC. If you gain a warden spell through this archetype, you become trained in spell attacks and spell DCs. Your spellcasting attribute is Wisdom.
You can use the {@action Hunt Prey|PC1} action.

feat.name: Basic Hunter's Trick
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level ranger|feats||Class=ranger|level=[1;2]} feat.

feat.name: Ranger Resiliency
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Ranger Dedication|PC1}, class granting no more Hit Points per level than 8 + your Constitution modifier
entries: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each ranger archetype class feat you have. As you continue selecting ranger archetype class feats, you continue to gain additional Hit Points in this way.

feat.name: Advanced Hunter's Trick
entries: You gain one {@filter ranger|feats||Class=ranger|level=[1;10]} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your ranger level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter ranger|feats||Class=ranger|level=[1;10]} feat.

feat.name: Master Spotter
entries: Your proficiency rank in {@skill Perception|PC1} increases to master.

feat.name: Rogue Dedication
entries: You gain a skill feat and the rogue's surprise attack class feature. You become trained in light armor. In addition, you become trained in {@skill Stealth|PC1} or {@skill Thievery|PC1} plus one skill of your choice; if you are already trained in both {@skill Stealth|PC1} and {@skill Thievery|PC1}, you become trained in an additional skill of your choice. You become trained in rogue class DC.

feat.name: Basic Trickery
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level rogue|feats||Class=rogue|level=[1;2]} feat.

feat.name: Sneak Attacker
entries: You gain the sneak attack class feature, except it deals {@dice 1d4} damage, increasing to {@dice 1d6} at 6th level. You don't increase the number of dice as you gain levels.

feat.name: Advanced Trickery
entries: You gain one {@filter rogue|feats||Class=rogue|level=[1;10]} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your rogue level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter rogue|feats||Class=rogue|level=[1;10]} feat.

feat.name: Skill Mastery
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Rogue Dedication|PC1}, trained in at least one skill and expert in at least one skill
entries: Increase your proficiency rank in one of your skills from expert to master and in another of your skills from trained to expert. You gain a skill feat associated with one of the skills you chose; you must meet all its prerequisites.
special: You can select this feat up to five times.

feat.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: You gain the {@classFeature deny advantage|Rogue|PC1|3} class feature.

feat.name: Evasiveness
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Rogue Dedication|PC1}, expert in Reflex saves
entries: Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to master.

feat.name: Witch Dedication
entries: You cast spells like a witch. Choose a patron; you gain a familiar with two common cantrips of your choice from your chosen patron's tradition, but aside from the tradition, you don't gain any other effects the patron would usually grant. Your familiar gains the normal number of abilities for a familiar instead of those a witch familiar normally gets.

You gain the {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} activity. You can prepare one cantrip each day from your familiar. You're trained in the spell attack modifier and spell DC statistics. Your key spellcasting attribute for witch archetype spells is Intelligence, and they are witch spells of your patron's tradition. You become trained in the skill associated with the patron's tradition; if you were already trained in it, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

feat.name: Basic Witch Spellcasting
entries: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits. Each time you gain a spell slot of a new rank from the witch archetype, add two common spells of that rank to your familiar.

feat.name: Basic Witchcraft
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level witch|feats||Class=witch|level=[1;2]} feat of your choice. You can select three familiar abilities for your familiar each day, instead of two.

feat.name: Advanced Witchcraft
entries: You gain one {@filter witch|feats||Class=witch|level=[1;10]} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your witch level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter witch|feats||Class=witch|level=[1;10]} feat.

feat.name: Patron's Breadth
entries: You can cast more spells each day. Increase the spell slots you gain from witch archetype feats by 1 for each spell rank other than your two highest spell ranks.

feat.name: Expert Witch Spellcasting
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Basic Witch Spellcasting|PC1}, master in the skill associated with your patron's tradition
entries: You gain the expert spellcasting benefits.

feat.name: Master Witch Spellcasting
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Expert Witch Spellcasting|PC1}, legendary in the skill associated with your patron's tradition
entries: You gain the master spellcasting benefits.

feat.name: Wizard Dedication
entries: You cast spells like a wizard, gaining a spellbook with four common arcane cantrips of your choice. You gain the {@action Cast a Spell|PC1} activity. You can prepare two cantrips each day from your spellbook. You're trained in the spell attack modifier and spell DC statistics. Your key spellcasting attribute for wizard archetype spells is Intelligence, and they are arcane wizard spells.

You become trained in {@skill Arcana|PC1}; if you were already trained in {@skill Arcana|PC1}, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. Select a school; you don't gain any abilities from your choice of school, but qualify for feats as a member.

feat.name: Arcane School Spell
entries: You gain your school's initial school spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can {@action Refocus|PC1} by studying.

feat.name: Basic Arcana
entries: You gain a {@filter 1st- or 2nd-level wizard|feats||Class=wizard|level=[1;2]} feat of your choice.

feat.name: Basic Wizard Spellcasting
entries: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits. Each time you gain a spell slot of a new rank from the wizard archetype, add two common spells of that rank to your spellbook.

feat.name: Advanced Arcana
entries: You gain one {@filter wizard|feats||Class=wizard|level=[1;10]} feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your wizard level is equal to half your character level.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another {@filter wizard|feats||Class=wizard|level=[1;10]} feat.

feat.name: Arcane Breadth
entries: Your thorough studies allow you to cast more arcane spells each day. Increase the spell slots you gain from wizard archetype feats by 1 for each spell rank other than your two highest wizard spell slots.

feat.name: Expert Wizard Spellcasting
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Basic Wizard Spellcasting|PC1}, master in {@skill Arcana|PC1}
entries: You gain the expert spellcasting benefits.

feat.name: Master Wizard Spellcasting
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Expert Wizard Spellcasting|PC1}, legendary in {@skill Arcana|PC1}
entries: You gain the master spellcasting benefits.

feat.name: Additional Lore
entries: Your knowledge has expanded to encompass a new field. Choose a {@skill Lore|PC1} skill subcategory. You become trained in it. At 3rd, 7th, and 15th levels, you gain an additional skill increase you can apply only to the chosen {@skill Lore|PC1} subcategory.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you must select a new subcategory of {@skill Lore|PC1} and you gain the additional skill increases to that subcategory for the listed levels.

feat.name: Adopted Ancestry
entries: You're fully immersed in another ancestry's culture and traditions, whether born into them, earned through rite of passage, or bonded through a deep friendship or romance. Choose a common ancestry or another ancestry to which you have access. You can select ancestry feats from the ancestry you chose, in addition to your character's own ancestry, as long as the ancestry feats don't require any physiological feature that you lack, as determined by the GM.

feat.name: Advanced First Aid
entries: You use your medical training to ameliorate sickness or assuage fears. When you use {@skill Medicine|PC1} to {@action Administer First Aid|PC1}, instead of Stabilizing a character or Stopping Bleeding, you can reduce an ally's {@condition frightened|PC1} or {@condition sickened|PC1} condition by 2, or remove either of those conditions entirely on a critical success. You can remove only one condition at a time. The DC for the {@skill Medicine|PC1} check is usually the DC of the effect that caused the condition.

feat.name: Alchemical Crafting
entries: You can use the {@action Craft|PC1} activity to create alchemical items. When you select this feat, you immediately add the formulas for four common 1st-level alchemical items to your formula book.

feat.name: Ancestral Paragon
entries: Whether through instinct, study, or magic, you feel a deeper connection to your ancestry. You gain a 1st-level ancestry feat.

feat.name: Arcane Sense
entries: Your study of magic allows you to instinctively sense its presence. You can cast 1st-rank {@spell detect magic|PC1} at will as an arcane innate spell. If you're a master in {@skill Arcana|PC1}, the spell is heightened to 3rd rank; if you're legendary, it is heightened to 4th rank.

feat.name: Armor Proficiency
entries: You become trained in light armor. If you already were trained in light armor, you gain training in medium armor. If you were trained in both, you become trained in heavy armor. If you are at least 13th level, you become an expert in this armor type.
special: You can select this feat more than once. Each time, you become trained in the next type of armor, as detailed above.

feat.name: Assurance
feat.prerequisites: trained in at least one skill
